dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old, blue Ambassador is parked in the middle of a star and barren landscape. A shabby building stands at a dista The camera is in the boot of the car and as the boot is lifted, we see Nandu (35) and Brian (34) silhouetted agai a bright afternoon sky. Nandu has his hands on his hips a Brian is peering into the boot. They are both dressed in unkempt winter clothes and look dishevelled. The camera is behind them now as Nandu and Brian awkwardl struggle to hoist a dead body wrapped in a sheet into the trunk. It does not fit. Nandu holds on to the feet that s out in an awkward position.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: (Holding onto the head) Why don’t you bend the knees, like in a foetal position? They exchange a look. They put the body in a foetal posit it fits. They slam the boot shut. On black we hear,

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: You're okay to drive?

dialogues.speaker: NANDU, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Ya. You got the papers right?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Yup. The doors close and the ignition starts. As the blue ambassador drives away we see revealed the dilapidated si Ranchi Morgue, against a stark landscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a series of long shots we see the same ambassador on a lonely stretch of a highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the window of the driver’s seat we see Nandu driv Brian is sitting in the passenger’s seat. He lights two cigarettes and gives Nandu one.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. RANCHI HIGHWAY. DUSK. 4
dialogues.text: Through the windscreen we see a third passenger in the backseat: Shutu (23), wearing a green woollen sweater, sitting at the edge of his seat. He looks worried and sca We move to an extreme close up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are on a wide lens on the side of the road. Highway in foreground and landscape at the back. The ambassador ente frame right and exits left. The title fades in as though floating on the landscape at the back: A DEATH IN THE GUN The frame bleaches to day as the titles fade out and the car, now quite dusty, passes left to right.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. RANCHI HIGHWAY. DAY. 6
dialogues.text: Inside the car Bonnie, Nandu’s wife, sleeps with her head lolled back. Super: One week earlier. Day One/Monday (27th DECEMBER) Bonnie (Barnali Bakshi) is about 34, has a quirky, pretty face and is wearing over-sized sunglasses with a scarf ti under her chin. Nandu and Bonnie’s daughter, Tania Bakshi is asleep on her mother’s lap, clutching an old rag doll. Their friend, Mimi (Mitali Basu) (34) is also in the back seat. Mimi is an abundantly sexy, well turned out woman. has a book open on her lap, though they are all sleeping. They are wearing winter, travelling clothes. Nandu sits in front, driving. His shirt sleeves rolled up a lit cigarette in one hand. There are empty beer bottles clinking on the floor of the car. Shutu sits in the front passenger seat. He has a Rubik’s in his hands though he is surreptitiously looking at MIMI reflection in the rear view mirror.  3. Nandu looks in the rear view mirror notices the girls hud up in the cold, sleeping at the back.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: All out. Shutu looks behind and turns back at Nandu, smiles and go back to his Rubik’s cube.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ambassador drives past a rusty signboard that reads: ‘McCluskiegunj: your visit will surprise you’, with a map underneath. We stay on the board as the car drives by. Shutu leans out of his window to get a better look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a long shot we see the car turning off the highway. As the car approaches the little town, the shops are clos Bonnie wakes up with a start, smoothens out her clothes a ties her hair.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: We've almost reached na... Remember to stop at Curney’s.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: If it’s still open. A shutter comes down on a shop as Nandu slows the car dow

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: No, no. It’s up ahead.

dialogues.speaker: TANI, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: (whispers) Mama, susu. Nandu pulls up to a small house. They all come out of the car, shaking off the stupor of the long ride and stretch their legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter a dilapidated house.  10

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Mrs. Curney! Are you still open? There is an old man, Mr. Curney, huddled up in the corner who doesn’t respond. Hearing a sound, Mrs. Curney pops he head out from behind a tatty lace curtain.

dialogues.speaker: MRS CURNEY
dialogues.text: Nandu! You’1l are finally here! I was waiting for you folks. Mrs Curney gives Tani a hug. MRS CURNEY (CONT’D) Hello deary! Tani is stiff and looks away. Bonnie smiles apologeticall

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: She's been sleeping. Is there a bathroom we can use?

dialogues.speaker: MRS CURNEY
dialogues.text: Of course! Come, come. (Turning to the others) Go ahead and have a look. Mrs Curney trails off as she takes Bonnie and Tani to the bathroom. MRS CURNEY (CONT’D) It’s a bit of a mess, don’t mind. Mimi remains outside looking at an old picture of Mr. and Mrs. Curney with a little girl from a happier, more prosperous time. Mr. Curney watches her blankly.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. CURNEY HOUSE
dialogues.text: Shutu is looking at patties and cakes under the old fashi glass counter. Mrs Curney bursts back in startling Shutu the process.

dialogues.speaker: MRS CURNEY
dialogues.text: Your mother mentioned you’1l were coming today so I kept a loaf aside for you.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Curney’s special loaf! Mrs Curney laughs, pleased.  11

dialogues.speaker: MRS CURNEY
dialogues.text: It gets sold out so soon. You know the holiday season?

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Of course. You remember my cousin, Shutu?

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Shyamal. Hello. Mrs Curney smiles vaguely at Nandu.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: He’s not been in a while actually... (To shutu) When’s the last time you were here?

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Err... Just last year I think. Bonnie and Tani come back out. Nandu takes out his wallet

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: We'd better hurry before it gets dark! Mrs. Curney takes out a small Christmas cake and places i the counter.

dialogues.speaker: MRS CURNEY
dialogues.text: Why don’t you take this also? Your old man will love it. It’s got rum in it. Nandu agrees reluctantly. MRS CURNEY (CONT’D) That will be 9 rupees and 4 annas only.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. MRS. CURNEY’S BAKERY. DUSK 11 Mrs. Curney hums a tune as she makes her way to the back the shop. She reaches the kitchen and puts her apron on. picks up a tied up, half-dead chicken and places it ona cutting block. With her back to camera, she raises her ha and brings it down on the block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car is going down a dirt road at the end of which is Nandu’s parent’s house. It is a lonely, isolated property with few neighbours. There are dense forests behind the house. The car reaches the worn wooden gate and honks lou There is a nameplate which reads ‘COL. (Retd) O.P Bakshi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maniya (45), the Adivasi caretaker, comes out onto the driveway with a torch to open the gate with a shy smile. is wearing a monkey cap and muffler. Nandu slows the car and Maniya leans in.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Kaisa hain Maniya? Mahua ka intezaam ho gaya?

dialogues.speaker: MANIYA
dialogues.text: Haan haan... Sabh taiyyaar hain! As the car pulls into the red graveled driveway of the ho Maniya shuts the gate behind them. A couple of dogs run behind the car and bark, adding to the commotion. We see the house lit up by the headlights of the car, the no power. Nandu’s parents, in their late sixties come out to the verandah to greet them, holding hurricanes. They are blin by the beam of light from the car. Uncle is portly, balding with a slight paunch. Aunty look frail but sturdy. She is wearing a sari with a sweater an shawl.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Manjari, aa jao. Woh log aa gaye hain. Tani runs to her grandparents with her rag doll in hand, followed by Bonnie. Mimi steps out with her vanity case i hand. Nandu throws the car keys to Shutu as he walks to t verandah with a bag in hand.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Open the dicky for Maniya. Shutu catches the keys. As he opens the boot, he stands a and watches the family greet each other. From his POV, we the house for the first time. It is a modest bungalow wit circuit house feel.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Arrey, bada time lag gaya tum logon ko.  14

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Did you manage to leave at 5?

dialogues.speaker: NANDU, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: By the time we left, it was almost 6. And then we had to pick up this Mimi also.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Arrey I was ready and waiting for you guys for ages! Maniya’s wife, Manjari, (45) also their cook, comes to he Shutu with the luggage. Shutu picks up his backpack and proceeds to the verandah.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Ki re Shutu? Exams over?

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: (Bends down to touch her feet) Yes, Mashi. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Ma bhalo? (How is your mother, all well?)

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Shob bhalo. (All well, thanks!) They proceed into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shutu puts a few bags down near the round dining table on which lies Aunty’s knitting kit. It is a combined living dining room with a fireplace and a bar cabinet in a corne string of season’s greetings cards hang over the mantelpi Above the fireplace is mounted a rifle, a .30 semi-automa carbine. Shutu pauses to look at a few family photographs mounted the wall.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Why hasn't the fire been lit yet?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE
dialogues.text: Look at these city people! Arrey, yeh thand toh kuch bhi nahi hain. Abhi January aane do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, we'll put hot water bottles and extra blankets in your rooms. Maniya, lakdi leke aao.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: You locked it?

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Uh.. No.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Go and lock it Shutu. This is Bihar!

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: And nobody ever steals anything in Cal na? Mimi walks across with her bag.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Yes, please lock it. You remember when we found that man sleeping in the car? My God.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: What? Really? Shutu looks surprised.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Why do you think we’re raising the boundary wall?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE
dialogues.text: 10,000 rupees we’re spending on it!

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: It’s been very cold off late.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE
dialogues.text: I don’t care how cold, how drunk. Thand ho toh mere gaadi mein soyega kya? Kal bolenge mere verandah mein sona hain. Nandu notices that Shutu is still standing there and listening.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Just go and lock it up Shutu! Shutu abruptly turns around to go outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 15 INT. BONNIE’S ROOM. NIGHT 15 Bonnie is unpacking in the guest bedroom which is simple pretty with lace curtains and some basic furniture. Tani jumping on the bed where some toiletries have been laid o

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Tani, get out of those filthy clothes first! Aunty enters with blankets and places it down on the bed. Bonnie takes out few tins of condensed milk, some lace serviettes, a bottle of cream and 2 tins of Yardley’s Tal powder gives it to Aunty. Inside the suitcase we can see bottles of alcohol and cigarette supplies.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Shonamuni, khe cho?

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Maa, tomar jeenish gulo.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Peyechish. Can’t get anything in this godforsaken place. Cha khabi toh?

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: No, we’ll have dinner soon na. Aunty makes a move to go.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh and we've got some Christmas Cake also. Curney managed to palm it off to Nandu.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Uff Curney... Aunty looks at Tani and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ek anna ka fika chai, Ek anna ka fulauri. Tani joins in, jumping with glee.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Maa, you don’t teach her these things. Aunty walks away laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shutu is huddled at the fire that has just been lit. Nand pouring the drinks and looks anxiously at his father. Aun walks in with serviettes.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: How is your knee Baba? Better?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE
dialogues.text: (Grunts ) At my age nothing gets better.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Face it Ma, you guys will have to move back to Cal sooner or later.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Oof! You’ve started already!

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE
dialogues.text: Arrey tumhe kis baat ki chinta hain? Doctor Goswami aata rehta hain na yaha.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Ha, ha aata rehta hain... Roj aata hain aur roj hamara ek bottle daru pee jata hain.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: (Laughing) Baba, agar aapko peena hain toh Dr. Uncle ke saath piyo. (To Aunty) But if something happens, you're going to call Vikram only na to drive him to Maandar.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Not that Vikram is going to be any less drunk. (Turning to Shutu) Shutu go and put on a sweater. The approaching headlights of a jeep shine into the livin room from outside. AUNTY (CONT’D) Whose car is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nandu opens the front door. The jeep halts at the veranda Their local friends Brian and Vikram step out of the jeep  11. Vikramjit Choudhary (38), a moustached man wears a rugged leather jacket, faded jeans and boots. Brian McKenzie (34 pleasant faced, burly Anglo-Indian man wears a hand knitt sweater and has a distinct small-town demeanor in compari to Vikram's confident swagger.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Arrey Jamai babu! Where’s your ghodi? Vikram laughs sheepishly and hugs Nandu. Vikram holds Nandu’s face in both his hands and kisses his cheeks loud

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Ghodi ya gaadi? Dekho jamai babu ko dowry mein kya mila. Brian gestures to VIKRAM’s new jeep.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: Kya mila? Yaha toh dena pada.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Made a killing ha? What happened to Stella? Nandu hugs Brian slapping him on his back. The three of t greet each other boisterously. NANDU (CONT’D) Brian! Good to see you man! Nandu notices Vikram taking out a big box from the back s of his jeep.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the fuck is that?

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: He he! Wait till Aunty sees this!

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: So much maska you maaro na... They laugh as they walk towards the main door from where Shutu watches their exchange shyly.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: You could use Stella while you’re here. Vikram notices Shutu. He points to something on Shutu’s shirt. Shutu looks down and Vikram flicks him on his chin

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How’re you pehelwan? Dekh isko itna daadi aa gaya?  18 12. Shutu, somewhat irked, gives him a tight smile while Bria musses his hair. He watches as the three of them go insid greet Aunty and Uncle.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Arrey Vikram beta aa gaye? Bahu ko ghar lekar aa gaye?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE
dialogues.text: Aur sabh kaisa raha? Sabh theek se ho gaya na shaadi mein? Vikram and Brian hug Uncle and Aunty.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: (Giving Aunty a kiss) Good good. Very hectic.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: What’s this Vikram? Vikram starts to open the box.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: Tan-ta-da! Vikram unwraps a shiny new cassette player. He places it the coffee table.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: (Delighted but a little embarrassed) Beta, we should be giving you presents... You shouldn’t have!

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: Arrey Aunty, I got two of these for the wedding. Besides, this is my second home isn’t it!

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: (While kissing him) What second home? We only see you when Nandu is in town.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE
dialogues.text: He’s a busy man now Anu, very busy. Huh?

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Not too busy to see us. And when do we get to meet the missus? Why didn’t you bring her?  13.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: No, no, I just dropped in on my way back from work. Besides she’s still recovering from the wedding!

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: So am I! We really missed you guys.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: (looking around for the others) Ya, ya. We really did.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: What to do beta, Uncle’s knees you know na...

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Tch, Bonnie really wanted to make it... just couldn’t get leave ya.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Anyway, this week we're doing dinner at home.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: You say when you are free? Tomorrow? Day after? Oh 31st!

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE
dialogues.text: Yes, done done. New Year party ghar pe hoga.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: Arrey I'm free only, ask this Brian fucker. He’s a chupa rustom. Tell them your big news. (Distracted) Where are the girls? Vikram walks away inside. Everyone turns to Brian curious Brian looks sheepish.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: What plans? You’re also getting married?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Vikram man! Nothing yaa... I may finally have a job.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Arrey well done beta! Challo let’s have some daaru shaaru!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 19 INT. BONNIE’S BEDROOM. NIGHT. 19 Tani has changed and unenthusiastically eats an omelette.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: You better finish that whole thing Tani.

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: I can’t have anymore. I’m going to do ulti.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: OK, OK leave it. Go and brush your teeth. Bonnie hands her a toothbrush and starts to comb her own when she hears something from the corridor. Vikram walks with a lantern.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: Fee Fi Fo Fum. I smell the blood of an English mem. Vikram puts the lantern down and goes to tickle Tani. Tan squeals and hides behind a pillow as he attacks her.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: (laughing) Where’s your wife? She’s outside? Bonnie peeks behind him expectantly.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: (Taking out a chocolate from his pocket) No, no. I couldn’t get her today. They are planning some dinner shinner outide. You’ll see her soon. Where is Mimi? Bonnie gives him a funny look and points to another room.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: She’s inside, in Uncle’s study.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 20 INT. SHUTU’S ROOM. NIGHT. 20 Shutu is alone in his poky little ante room rummaging thr his backpack. He takes out a sweater and puts it on. He k a few books on the desk. He takes out his toothbrush, a f clothes and opens the cupboard. Inside he finds a pile of warm clothes and some miscellan items.  21 22 23 15. He puts his clothes on a shelf and runs his hands through woollens. He notices one he recognizes and pulls it out. looks at it for a moment and then smells it. He quickly t off the sweater he is wearing and puts on the other one. is a hand knit, moth eaten, olive green sweater. He hugs himself and is still for a moment, leaning into t open cupboard.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. MIMI’S ROOM. NIGHT 21 Mimi has emptied her duffel bag. She is standing on a sto and attempting to store it away above the cupboard. As sh raises her arms, her waist is exposed. Vikram sees this a comes and leans at the door.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: Need any help? Mimi turns around and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Mr. Vikramjit Choudhury! She jumps off the stool and comes across to hug him.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Congratulations! How was the honeymoon? She leans in to kiss him on the cheek. Vikram kisses Mimi the lips, surprising her but she lets him.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. CORRIDOR - OUTSIDE MIMI’S ROOM. NIGHT 22 Shutu who was passing through the corridor happens to see couple. He looks on intensely.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. CORRIDOR - OUTSIDE MIMI’S ROOM. NIGHT. 23 Shutu’s POV: As the couple kiss, the lights flicker a few times and the power comes back dimly. Shutu steps back in the shadow. There are cheers from outside.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Batti aa gayi Manjari. Khana laga do.  24 25 26 16. From outside the door we see Vikram and Mimi kiss until Vikram reaches back to shut the door, without a sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Shutu walks in, others have gathered around the dining table, sitting down for dinner.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: So Australia. So far? You'll be taking Aunty with you?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Let’s see once I get there.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: I’m glad you're getting out of here. When’s your joining date?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Feb onwards, I think.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: (sits down next to Brian) Congratulations Brian!

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Arrey, eta Baba’r sweater na? (This is your father’s sweater, isn’t it?) Shutu smiles at Aunty as she starts to serve him. Vikram walks in. Mimi follows. Shutu looks at them curiously. Vi picks up some salad from Bonnie’s plate. We pull back to wider frame as all of them have dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exterior shot of the house at night taken from the gate. There are warm, yellow lights inside the house. We can he cicadas. Even though it is a symmetrical frame, we get th feeling that something is amiss. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fade in.  27 28 17. Shutu and Tani walk down a path off the backyard, lined b series of trees. He has a rope strung around his shoulder while he tries to roll a tire ahead of him. Tani helps hi Shutu sets the tire down, jumps and tries to touch the br of a tree. He can’t reach it. The super reads Day 2/Tuesday (28th DECEMBER)

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: Where’s the family tree?

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: It’s ahead. She looks around and runs towards a tree with a large tru Some names have been scratched onto the bark. She runs ar the trunk, reading the names aloud.

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: Anupama, O.P, Nandu, Bonnie, Tani. Shutu goes towards a low lying branch. He jumps and hangs from it.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Tani! Come for a bath.

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: No Mamma, not now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the backyard, Bonnie picks up a tin bucket warming in sun and goes inside through the back door of the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: I’m going in. You come in 5 minutes.

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: Where’s your name?

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Uh... It’s not there? Shutu is tying a knot around the tyre.

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: No.  29 18. Suddenly, there is a shriek from inside the house. They t around to look.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. BONNIE’S ROOM. DAY 29 Bonnie is terrified and is looking at something inside th bathroom from the door. Nandu rushes into the room. He ha half his face covered in shaving foam and a brush in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: What? What happened?

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Frog! Frog! There’s a frog inside! Aunty rushes into the room.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: What happened? What happened!

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: (Dismissively walking away ) Nothing! It’s just a damn frog. Can’t expect to come to McCluskiegunj and not find a frog.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: (Alarmed) Manjari! Jaldi aao! Yeh andar kaise aayaa? Manjari walks in and stands there impassively. Tani and S run in.

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: What happened Mama?

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Arrey Manjari, khade khade kya dekh rahe ho? jhadu toh leke aao! Ye andar kaise aaya? Manjari exits to get the broom. Shutu takes off his slipp and treads carefully into the bathroom in an attempt to c it away.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Oh no! It’s gone behind the commode now. (Yelps) It’s looking straight at me! Tani starts jumping adding to the chaos.  30 19.

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: I saw it! There it is! I saw it! Manjari comes back with a broom and goes into the bathroo She makes a gesture for Shutu to leave. Shutu meekly step outside.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Hum bole the na bada naali ko bandh rakhne ke liye, sabh bathroom mein. Kisne khola isko? Voh lakdi ka tukda kaha gaya?

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: Oh now it’s gone behind the bucket! Close shot of a large, ugly toad looking balefully into camera.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. SHUTU’S ROOM. AFTERNOON. 30 Shutu is sitting at a desk by the window of his tiny room is wearing his moth eaten sweater. There are a couple of books in front of him, including a thick mathematics textbook, a collection of essays, a slim volume of poetry is drawing a frog over and over again in his journal when takes out a folded sheet of paper from it. He stares at i first, then absentmindedly starts to doodle on it. We see that it is his mark sheet of his M.Sc. final year that he failed. His elaborate doodle has engulfed his name, Shyam Chatterjee, to a point that it is barely legible. Suddenl the door opens and Tani peeps in. Shutu looks at the door while folding the mark sheet away.

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: (making a sad face) I’m bored. Tani comes in and lies down on his bed. Shutu closes his journal and looks at her seriously.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: I don’t like it over here.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: There are insects everywhere. There’s no cement. No T.V  20.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: No cement? Where’s Bonnie di?

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: Sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Baba?

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: Sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Hmm.

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: What were you doing?

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: I was er... Shutu flips his journal open. It is full of random scribb and drawings. It opens on a page where Shutu has sketched many frogs. SHUTU (CONT’D) I was trying to draw the frog, see? Tani gets up and comes over to the desk, delighted.

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: I like this one. She looks at a few other drawings.

dialogues.speaker: TANI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s this? She points to a list of words, all starting with the lett ‘E’.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Those are my e words. Words I like that start with ‘E’. Tani starts reading the words aloud as we pull back to se the two of them poring over the notebook together in a qu corner of the room. Tani starts reading the words aloud, stumbling over the pronunciations. We can hear gentle sno coming from one of the bedrooms.

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: Entropy, Ersatz, Ennui...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle, Aunty, Brian and Bonnie are playing bluff at the table. Tani has fallen asleep on the sofa. Vikram, Mimi a Nandu are drinking and chatting. Uncle dramatically puts his last four cards.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE
dialogues.text: 4 kings!

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Arrey! What do you mean 4 kings?

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: You just put down 4 kings! Ma, he’s lying! He’s lying.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: I know he’s lying. Check those cards. Bonnie goes to check the cards.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE
dialogues.text: You can’t touch those cards. Those are pass cards. Challenge karo! Utha ke dekh lo.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: I challenge you. Challenge!

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Aunty don’t do it. I’m telling you! Aunty turns over the cards which turn out to be 4 kings.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Well, at least I didn’t cheat!

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE
dialogues.text: Who’s cheating? I never cheat.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Chalo you guys carry on. I’m going to go to bed now. Good night!

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Good night Ma. Aunty gets up to go. Uncle follows.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: See you at lunch tomorrow, Uncle!

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE
dialogues.text: Yes, yes. Good night Dylan!  32 22. Brian reacts, mildly amused at Uncle. Bonnie gets up to p up the sleeping Tani. Seeing them Vikram takes his cue to leave.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: We should also be heading out now.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Arrey it’s only 10:30!

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Don’t you guys dare go anywhere, I’m just putting Tani to bed and coming back. Bonnie exits carrying the sleeping child.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: Fine! Give me another drink in that case. Mimi gladly gets up to make Vikram another drink.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. BONNIE’S BEDROOM. NIGHT 32 As Bonnie puts Tani down on her bed, she wakes up.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Shh... Go back to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: Mama, don’t go. Don’t leave me. Bonnie sits down next to her and strokes her hair.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Come on, you’re almost 7 years old. Big girl!

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: (Clinging to Bonnie’s neck) No, no, I’m not big.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: But you’re so brave at home! What are you so scared of?

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: (looks at the window) That window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shutu is out for a cigarette. From his POV we see Bonnie she walks over to the window to close the curtains.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: (muffled) See, I’m drawing the curtains. Better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vikram is in the midst of an anecdote with the others cos sitting around the coffee table, the fire lit behind them Mimi has a shawl wrapped around and her hair falls loosel over her shoulders. She sits cross-legged on the carpeted floor. Shutu, also sits on the floor and stares at Vikram with wide-eyed concentration.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: I swear, it was a table like this one. It just went off the ground. Like so much. (Demonstrates with his hands )

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Balls! How do you know someone wasn’t lifting it with their knees?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Even I was there! No one was lifting it for Christ’s sake!

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: (Walking into the room, interrupting) Who? Who? What happened?

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: So you’re saying that your neighbor, Uncle Harris, re- established contact with the living world as a wooden table?

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: Well, Mrs. Harris continues to believe that. The other day she asked if I'd like to join “them” for tea.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Are you serious? She and her dead husband! Everyone laughs.  24.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: But it’s true. These things happen... Sometimes spirits inhabit people or objects and just never ever leave.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Why would they come back at all?

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: (Looks at Shutu teasingly) Unfinished business, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Okay okay! Let’s just start now. Nandu, come sit down here. Mimi pats the carpet next to her. Nandu looks at her from arm chair but doesn’t budge.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Oh no let’s not! I have to go back and sleep alone.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: You sleep with your mother tonight.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Do we have to make a chart with ABC and all?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: You can do it through a medium also na? Like in Exorcist?

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Fuck... That movie...

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: (Interrupting) Okay okay... but who are we calling tonight?

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Ya, because I’m not doing a planchet for just anyone.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Should we call Elvis?

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Are we even sure he’s really dead?

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: Arrey let’s call someone closer home man.  25.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Okay, Nehru then?

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Ya. Nehru really needs to have a chat with his daughter! Everyone breaks into laughter except Shutu. Shutu looks uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: Okay, so who will be the medium? Everyone looks expectantly at each other. Vikram looks ar but his gaze stops at Shutu. With him, everyone looks at Shutu. Shutu feels everyone’s gaze upon him. Looks uncomfortable and laughs nervously.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: No, no I don’t want to take part in all this.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Chal, ok you don’t have to be a medium...

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Shutuuu... Why?

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: (hesitant) No no it... I believe it causes them a lot of pain or something. The others laugh. Vikram and Nandu exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: But they’re dead ya. How can they feel pain?

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: (While getting up) You all carry on I’m going, I’m quite sleepy.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: Sleepy... or scared?

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: No, no. Nothing like that...

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Come on Shutu. Grow up! Shutu smiles and sits back down reluctantly.  26.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: But wait, do we have to make a chart and all now?

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: (Clearing the table) No, we’ll do it like this. Let’s all hold hands. Everyone sits around the coffee table and holds hands.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Okay! Eyes closed, Eyes closed! There are some muffled giggles and whispers.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: Shhh! (Clears his throat, after a few moments) Panditiji, are you here? Everyone breaks into giggles which is interrupted by a su sound. Everybody startles and looks at the door. The main door is opened from outside. Maniya walks in with some firewood. He is surprised to find everyone’s gaze on him.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Oh Maniya...

dialogues.speaker: MANIYA
dialogues.text: Sahab, gate bandh kardein?

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Chaabi rakh do, hum kar lenge.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: Aur Maniya, mombatti leke aao. Maniya exits from the back corridor.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Mombatti?

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: If we’re doing this, let’s do this right. Put off the big light and let's sit around the dining table.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Hang on! Let’s get our refills before starting. Nandu, Mimi and Vikram go to the bar. Bonnie and Brian mo to the dining table. Shutu doesn’t move from the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE, (0.C)
dialogues.text: Shutu, come na. Pull up that stool.  27.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Come on guys! Hurry up! Maniya lights the candle at the table. Vikram is doing something at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: (Whispering to Nandu and Mimi) You guys sit. I’m coming. Nandu and Mimi walk towards the dining table, drinks in h Maniya walks in with the candles. Vikram comes and sits a the table as Maniya lights the last candle and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maniya, woh light off kardo. Maniya raises his hand to switch off the light and looks his shoulder. From Maniya’s POV: Everyone is settling dow holding hands around the table. Their faces only visible the dim candle light as Maniya switches off the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maniya makes his way though a dirt track leading to his h The torchlight illuminates the path in flashes; glimpses the backyard, a mound of cement and a few bricks in a cor dense forest cover beyond. The sound of cicadas grows gradually as he reaches his hut.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 36 INT. MANIYA’S HUT. NIGHT. 36 Manjari has worn a bright sari and is putting flowers in hair. Maniya switches off the torch in the hut that is di lit by a kerosene lamp.

dialogues.speaker: MANJARI
dialogues.text: Sab sueet gele hai?

dialogues.speaker: MANIYA
dialogues.text: (while locking his door) Kaha sutle... Daaru piyat hain. Bhoot bulawat hain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is seated around the dining table, their grim an serious faces illuminated only by candle light.  28. Everyone's eyes are closed, holding hands. Vikram and Nan are sitting beside each other.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: Is anybody here? Silence. A beat later...

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Any spirit passing by?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: (whispering) Ask if any good spirit is passing by?

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Good spirits don’t come so easily. It’s the evil ones who are restless, wanting to communicate. Nandu looks at Shutu, who looks spooked. A prolonged sile

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: Is any spirit, good or evil, passing by? A longer interval and then a sudden knocking sound. Every opens their eyes in a start. Shutu looks alarmed. Brian l accusingly at Vikram first and then Nandu.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Aye Bugger, you made that noise! Nandu raises his hands to show Brian. Brian looks around checks under the table.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: I’m not doing anything! Vikram gives Brian a look. Brian catches on and plays alo

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Somebody made that sound right?

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: The sound didn’t even come from here.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Ya, the sound came from that side.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Wait, wait. Let’s try again.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Shh... Concentrate now.  29.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: Don't break the circle, otherwise the spirit can get trapped here. (Pause) Everyone close your eyes. Everyone closes their eyes again. After a few moments,

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Any spirit passing by? Please communicate with us. A beat. A continuous knocking sound. Everyone opens their eyes and looks at each other alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: (Urgently) Someone’s come.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: They're trying to communicate! The knocking sound stops.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: Is a spirit present? There is a single, definite sharp knock.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is that a ‘YES’? Another sharp knock.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you a man?

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: (Looking at VIKRAM) WERE you a man.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: Okay ya... Were you a man? A beat and two knocks indicating a no.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is that a ‘NO’? One sharp knock indicating yes.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Were you a woman? A definite knock indicating a yes.  30. Under the table, the camera follows the string from VIKRA little finger till across the hallway, down on the floor, wedged behind a door we see the cigarette tin. On these visuals we hear the ongoing conversation with the spirit.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you die of natural causes? A beat and two knocks indicating no.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: That’s a no right?

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: How did you die? A prolonged silence.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: That’s not a yes or no question!

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Shhhhh!

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. Were you killed? The tin is tugged twice indicating no.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you kill yourself? The tin is tugged once indicating yes. Gasps from the table. There is an uncomfortable silence a Bonnie exchanges a suspicious look with Brian.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have you been watching us? Silence. A definite knock indicating a yes.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who in this room will die first? (PAUSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will it be me? Two knocks indicating a no.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nandu? Two knocks. Nandu and Vikram exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Brian? Two knocks.  38 38. 39 40 31.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mimi? Two knocks.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bonnie ? Shutu, who is sitting next to Bonnie breaks into a sweat he realizes he is the last one left. His face is tense. Two knocks indicating a no.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shutu? A prolonged silence. A single knock indicating yes. Shutu gets up immediately, pushing his chair back with a sound.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: (In a strangled voice) I’m going to bed. As Shutu exits, Bonnie realizes it’s a prank as they all start laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A visibly disturbed Shutu leaves the room with an urgency goes into his room. He gets under the mosquito net and hi under the blanket. INT. BONNIE’S ROOM. NIGHT 38. A Tani is asleep. We track back from her to include the win There is muffled laughter from out side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian has picked a couple of stones and is aiming at a window.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: (In a panic) What are you doing?! Tani will wake up!  4l 42 32. Vikram sniggers and goes ahead. Brian guffaws at his mist

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: (pointing to another window) Guys, it’s this one here.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Shh... Guys stop it now! Brian listens to Bonnie and throws his stone away but Vik throws a stone at Shutu’s window and misses. Nandu and Mi are a few steps ahead. They hear faint singing from afar accompanied by a Maadol (native drum).

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Wow! It’s a full moon night. (Pause) Hey, what’s that sound?

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Arrey Maniya and all are awake! Come guys, let’s crash Maniya’s party! Nandu and Mimi walk ahead with Brian and Bonnie following Vikram takes aim at Shutu’s window once again.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. SHUTU’S ROOM. NIGHT. 4l Shutu watches the strange pattern of shadows on the ceili His eyes widen with alarm as he hears a sharp sound from window. He stares ahead, rigid with fear.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. MANIYA’S HUT. NIGHT. 42 Maniya, Manjari and some of their friends are drinking Ma They are dancing around a bonfire, with their arms linked Nandu and Mimi, their cheeks flushed from the cold and th alcohol, grin widely and clap along. Vikram, Brian and Bo catch up with Nandu and Mimi.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: (Going up to the circle of dancers ) Oh wow! Manjari offers her arm to include Bonnie. She joins them enthusiastically. They all join the circle, trying to learn the song: “Toot Gachhe Bhoot Nache” and match steps.  43 44 45 46 33. Some of them are smoking ganja. Unnoticed by others, Mimi Vikram have an intimate moment. Maniya passes them Mahua some coarse salt and chilli on a Saal leaf. Nandu takes o his own bottle from deep within his jacket and offers it them. The dancing and chanting reaches a frenzied pitch. In a wide shot, we see the dark house, the drunken whirli and the quiet forest beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire is out. The sound of a heartbeat gradually incre in intensity. On the mantle piece we see dusty memorabili like army medals, photographs and a plaque. Above that is mounted the Rifle. A hand enters frame and plucks the rif off the wall. We follow the hand through the corridor int Shutu’s room. One hand holds the rifle, the other lifts t mosquito net. The hand pulls down the blanket from Shutu’ face. It turns Shutu’s face towards camera with the barre the rifle. Shutu’s face lolls back in such a way, we real he is already dead.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. BUNGALOW - SHUTU’S ROOM. NIGHT 44 From outside the mosquito net, we see Shutu enter frame a sits up sweating and panting. The sound of the heartbeat mixed with the chanting outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOT of the Bungalow from the gate. Full Moon. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fade in. Nandu dismounts the rifle from the wall. He blow away the dust from it. The super reads Day 3/Wednesday (29th DECEMBER)

dialogues.speaker: NANDU, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Look at the state of this rifle, Baba. Kaise pada hua hain?  34.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: (Interjecting, taking the rifle back from Nandu) Kahe ka working rifle? Poora jung lag chuka hain. Ammunition bhi pata nahi kaha hain. Shutu follows the action closely.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Main saaf kar deta hoon na?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Nahi, nahi. Leave it. These things let me only do. (Keeping the rifle away) Aur kis ke liye use karenge isko? Murgi maarne ke liye? Shutu looks up as Mimi walks in, wearing a tight turtle n and a pair of fitted bell bottom jeans. Mimi picks up a cigarette and looks for a lighter. Shutu eagerly removes matchbox from his pocket and lights Mimi’s cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Why? Vikram and his gang go for shikaar quite often. They hunt for wild boar and all. Aunty comes out of her bedroom, hurriedly putting on her watch.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Everyone ready? Manjari! E ki Shutu, shave korbi na? (Aren’t you going to shave?) Shutu who is still wearing his green sweater, smiles sheepishly.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: (Yelling out) Bonnie! How much longer? Tani runs out and Bonnie follows, flustered.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Some of us believe in having a bath, you know?

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Even in winter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunty and Manjari are in the verandah. Bonnie and Mimi ha walked ahead on the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Dekho yeh majdoor log aaj bhi late aaye hain. Manjari, kaam late tak chalega toh, tala laga dena kidhar bhi jaao. Hum shaam tak aa jayenge. Manjari is silent.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kya hua? Sir abhi bhi dukh raha hain? Dawa de du? Manjari shakes her head and leaves. Aunty looks exasperat at Tani who holds her hand and walks down the steps. AUNTY (CONT’D) You just never know what these people are thinking. Aunty goes up to the car in which Nandu and Uncle are alr seated.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Come on Ma!

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: I’m coming! I’m going to drive. You sit at the back.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: But you haven’t driven in so long, Ma.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: So what? You never forget how to drive. Nandu and Uncle exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car drives off as Shutu closes the gate behind it. EXT. BRIAN’S HOUSE - STREAM. DAY 48 Brian, Vikram, Nandu and Mimi are horsing around at the stream. Vikram and Nandu are trying to get Brian wet and off his shirt which happens to rip apart.  36.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. MCKENZIE, (0.C)
dialogues.text: Kitty!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 49 EXT. BRIAN’S HOUSE. DAY 49 Mrs. McKenzie, Brian's widowed mother is a lady in her la sixties. She is a bit of a memsahib, who is fussily arran napkins at the makeshift dining tables set up in their fr lawn.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. MCKENZIE
dialogues.text: We'll serve the mulligatawny first. I need one more soup spoon please. Kitty is the capable, catholic house help who is hovering around Mrs. McKenzie, awaiting instruction.

dialogues.speaker: KITTY
dialogues.text: What you want to put the chicken in?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. MCKENZIE
dialogues.text: I’ve put out the Doulton casserole. Bring it in that.

dialogues.speaker: A EXT. LAWN. DAY. 49. A
dialogues.text: Bonnie walks up to Shutu and watches the others over at t stream.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: (Shouting out) Isn't the water too cold?

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: It’s fun! Come na Bonnie!

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: (To Shutu) Aashbi? Shutu smiles and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tani ke dekhish toh. Bonnie joins the others in the stream. Shutu looks over a Tani, absorbed with the puppies.  49. 50 37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian is in the lawn where Tani is playing with a few pup in a basket. Mrs. McKenzie, Uncle and Aunty are sitting o white cane chairs and chatting. There is a bowl of chips, peeled, half eaten orange and a few glasses of juice in f of them.

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: Brian uncle, what are their names?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: They don’t have names. We are giving them away.

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: You won't keep even one of them?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: This one hasn’t found a home yet, so I guess he can stay here with us. Brian notices Tani’s sympathetic face.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Unless... you want to keep him?

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: (Breaking into a shy grin) Can I? Shutu? Shutu! Shutu doesn’t hear her and is still looking at the others

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bonnie is ankle deep in the water near Mimi, contemplatin whether she should go in further.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: Arrey come on in Bonnie!

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: No baba. It’s too cold. Earlier we've gone in even till here also. (Indicating her hip) Ask him.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Ya and she swam to Chatti Nadi.  51 52 38.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: (Teeth chattering) I can’t feel my feet anymore! I’m going back now.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?! Vikram turns to Mimi and scoops her up in his arms swiftl Mimi bursts into giggles and squeals while she clings to Vikram’s neck. They all laugh and Nandu and Bonnie exchan look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nandu and Vikram wear their shoes, drying themselves in t sun. They are watching Bonnie and Mimi walking in the distance. Vikram’s gaze is fixed on Mimi. Nandu notices h

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Nice view huh?

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: Ya, it’s nice.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: (Looking pointedly at

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: So... When do we get to meet... the Mrs?

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: (Looks at Nandu sharply) Purnima? (Looking back at the girls) I’ll get her along one of these days.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Question is why didn’t you get her along today?

dialogues.speaker: MRS MCKENZIE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Lunch is ready!

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: Lunch is ready! I’m hungry.  53 39. Vikram smiles at Nandu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The food has been laid out on the dining table. Bonnie, T Uncle and Aunty are already seated.

dialogues.speaker: MRS MCKENZIE
dialogues.text: Hurry up! Hurry up! Before the soup gets cold! Brian pull up a chair.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Brian, you're really going to miss your mom’s cooking over there. Think about it.

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: Please Mama! All my friends have pets.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: First you tell me what you want to eat. I’1l give you chicken and rice? Nandu, Mimi and Shutu are joining the others as Vikram ta to Uncle.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Umm. Pepper chicken, coconut rice...

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Cutlets! Nandu reaches out to pick up a cutlet and sits down next Mimi. Shutu is about to sit on the other side of Mimi.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Shutu just get my shawl na. It’s on that chair. Shutu who was about to sit down, goes to get the shawl. Vikram casually sits down next to Mimi. Mrs McKenzie continues to serve others with the help of Kitty.

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: (Turning Bonnie’s face) Please mama! I’1l take him to do susu, potty everything. Shutu will help me. Na Shutu? Shutu hands Bonnie the shawl and gets pulled into this conversation.  54 55 40.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Ya. I’ll help you. Come on Bonnie di. Bonnie rolls her eyes at Shutu.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Now you don’t start.

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: But you only keep saying I’m an only child.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Oof! This girl won’t leave me in peace. Okay. Maybe. We’ll see. Tani considers this an approval and gets up. Shutu smiles looking at Tani.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Arrey I didn’t say yes! First come back here and finish your food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the foreground, we see a glass of juice knocked over o the rug, flies hovering around a half eaten orange, the p of Shutu’s novel flutter in the breeze. In the background see the dining table in a blur, Tani and the dogs running around it with abandon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Post lunch, Uncle has nodded off in his arm chair. The ot are sitting around and having desert on the chairs. Shutu lying on the rug, reading 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea by Jules Verne. Mimi notices his book as she takes out cream from her handbag.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: What are you reading? Shutu shows her the book.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: I’m just reading it again.  56 41.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: You should have really studied Literature. You're what, third year now?

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: (laughs) No, no. I just finished my M.Sc. I'll be applying for a Ph.D. soon.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: You're toh always first class first na? Weren’t you planning to go abroad or something?

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Ya. I'll be applying for a scholarship.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: And if you don’t get that? Shutu smiles and shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (teasingly) Does that leave you much time for a girlfriend? Shutu laughs sheepishly.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on, a handsome boy like you! At this point Aunty calls out to Shutu, holding out her desert dish.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Shutu, get me a second helping please.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: (to MIMI) I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. BRIAN’S HOUSE. DAY 56 Shutu enters a long, gloomy corridor. The walls have old family photographs hanging. As he turns into the kitchen, Vikram comes out from an inner bathroom into the corridor muted flush is heard. Vikram hears a sound from the kitch and goes in that direction. He stands at the door of the kitchen and watches Shutu taking out some desert. With a mischievous glint in his eye, Vikram picks up an empty gl from the side board and rolls it across the kitchen floor  57 58 42. Shutu reacts to the eerie sound with fear. As the glass touches Shutu’s feet, he almost trips and drops the deser bowl. Vikram laughs loudly as he slaps Shutu on the back walks down the corridor into the burnt out exterior. Shutu bends down to pick up the broken bowl. The camera lingers on the glass; still rolling gently on sloping kitchen floor.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 57
dialogues.text: EXT. BRIAN’S HOUSE. DAY 58 Tani is sitting behind the wheel of Nandu’s car, parked n the gate. Shutu gets in the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Lets go home Tani. Shutu slides down on the seat, almost lying down.

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: Come on, let’s go Baba! She blares the horn loudly as she calls out to her father from the window. Nandu comes up to the car with a drink i his hand, amused at Tani behind the wheel. He leans in at window.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: They're still saying bye. (He opens the door) Move in. Unless you want to drive us home? Tani giggles at the suggestion as she sidles up to Shutu makes space for her father. NANDU (CONT’D) No? What about you Shutu? Hmm? Its a short distance. Shutu brushes off the suggestion with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Oh no, I’ve not had any practice since...

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Well it’s about time you did! Shutu looks unsure. Tani climbs over to the backseat, ver excited.  43.

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: Come on Shutu! Nandu and Shutu get out and cross over to exchange places Nandu hands him the keys as they cross. Shutu gets in the driver’s seat.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Let’s back it out of the gate. We'll take a quick chakker. Shutu fiddles with the gear, trying all the other gear positions before getting into reverse. As soon as he star the car and begins to reverse, the engine goes off. He nervously starts the car again. Nandu and Tani both look him apprehensively. Nandu looks behind to try to direct h NANDU (CONT’D) Ok, easy now. Watch out for that rock. The car moves back jerkily with a loud noise of the accelerator being pushed too hard. NANDU (CONT’D) Stop. Stop. Relax. Start again. Adjust the rear view mirror. Side view mirror? Hand brake? Shutu is beginning to sweat. He adjusts the mirrors. He starts the car again but the engine goes off. NANDU (CONT’D) Put the gear in neutral Shutu! Shutu fumbles with the gear. He is about to start again.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: 10 and 2. Shutu looks at him blankly. Nandu gets more exasperated. NANDU (CONT’D) Hand position Shutu! 10 and 2. Nandu places Shutu’s hands in the correct position. NANDU (CONT’D) Come on come on! Be grateful my dad isn’t teaching you. You know what he did when I made a mistake? Nandu raps Shutu on the back of his head, lightly.

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: Baba!
Shutu summons up his last shred of confidence and jerkily reverses the car. Nandu quickly takes the glass back from dash board.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Relax Tani, this is how you learn. Hey! Nandu looks alarmed as the car moves unsteadily towards t gate. NANDU (CONT’D) Slow down, slow down! Stay left, left! Brake! Brake! Everyone at the lawn reacts to the crashing sound. In a w shot we see Shutu has lost control of the car. The left t light breaks and the car comes to an abrupt halt. Nandu g out and slams the door in irritation. NANDU (0.C.) (CONT’D) Jesus Shutu! Get out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nandu drives disdainfully with Uncle, Aunty and Tani in t back seat. Tani is holding a basket with the puppy in it. one point they over take Bonnie, Mimi and Shutu who are walking back home. INT. MCCLUSKIEGUNJ HOUSE - BONNIE’S ROOM. NIGHT. 59 Tani is sitting on the bed like a proud mother with the p asleep on her lap. Aunty sits behind her, combing her lon hair. Tani is trying hard to stay still so that the puppy doesn’t wake up. Mimi is lying on the bed as Bonnie tidie the room.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: I hope this one has better luck than your previous pets.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: (Frowning at MIMI) Chico is very happy in doggy heaven, thank you!

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Of course! Along with Wolfie, Sheeba and what was the name of that tortoise?

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: They're keeping each other company!  45.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Kalidas! Poor fellow, he must still be wandering around these parts! Tani follows the conversation suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: Why? What happened to Kalidas?

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Nothing. He just went for a walk and never came back!

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Ya because we all forgot to bring him back!

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: (deeply disapproving) You forgot to bring him back?

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, he’s alive. Tortoises live to be more than a hundred years. Maybe he’1ll come back one day!

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Come back? I’m sure the adivasis have eaten him by now! Tani looks horrified.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Never mind! So what are we naming this one?!

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: Fluffy!

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: (making a face) Fluffy?

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: And who's going to look after him once we go back?

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: (shrugs with a grin) Shutu. They break into laughter.

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: Oh Mama he’s done susu on me!  60 61 46.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: This is why I’d said not on the bed! Bonnie gives the puppy to Mimi.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get up. Let’s get you changed.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Wait, I’1l organize some bedding.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI, (FRENCH)
dialogues.text: Who’s going to stay with you now? I have to go work now. Aunty gets up. Bonnie and Tani go into the bathroom. Mimi lies down on the bed with the puppy curled up on her ches

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. MCCLUSKIEGUNJ HOUSE - BONNIE’S ROOM - NIGHT 60 Tani is fast asleep as Bonnie tosses and turns beside her The puppy’s whimpers are relentless and grow in desperati At one point, Bonnie sits up and looks at the pup with exasperation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the dimly lit room, Shutu sits on a stool and Nandu on arm chair. They are absorbed in a game of chess with just few chessmen remaining. Nandu sips his drink and observes Shutu’s move.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Hmm... at least your chess is better than your driving. They hear footsteps from the corridor. Uncle walks into t living room wearing his flannel dressing gown and a miner helmet with a torch. He goes up to a cabinet, opens a dra and looks for something. NANDU (CONT’D) Kya hua Baba? Can’t sleep?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE
dialogues.text: No, no nothing. I just came to get my... Uncle looks vaguely at the shelf as if he can’t quite remember.  62 62. 62. 62. 47.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: What? What do you need? NANDU (CONT’D) Go to sleep Baba. We’1ll look for it in the morning. Uncle shuffles off towards his own room. Nandu looks back the board and is just about to make his next move when he hears footsteps again. His concentration is broken.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tch...! Bonnie walks in holding the bedding with the puppy in it.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: (Handing over the bedding to Shutu) Here. I’ve had enough! Now you deal with this. Bonnie walks away. Nandu is clearly annoyed. He goes back completes his move. Shutu, stroking the puppy gently, concentrates on the board. The loud sound of a sputtering bike rings through the nig Nandu sits up erect on his arm chair and looks in that direction.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Stella!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. MIMI’S BEDROOM. NIGHT. 62 Mimi is in her room alone, working. She is writing someth at her desk when she suddenly hears the motorcycle and tu to the window. She sees Vikram zipping across on the bike

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bike passes across the front verandah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vikram zips across on his bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bike passes across the back corridor.  63 48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vikram is circling the garden area, on his motorcycle. He clearly inebriated. Nandu comes down the verandah steps followed by Shutu.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: (delighted) Fucker, everyone will wake up. Vikram stops the bike at the verandah.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: (To Nandu) Come on! Let’s take her for a spin!

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: It's freezing!

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: Don’t be a pussy. Stella is nice and warm for you. Shutu looks at the bike curiously. Vikram pulls out a hip flask and gives it to Nandu.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Fuck off man.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: Take a sip, you won’t feel so cold. Nandu takes a sip and grimaces.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Ahh! Let me get my jacket. Nandu goes in, passing Mimi who has come out wearing a jacket. Vikram starts the engine.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: Ah, see how she purrs for me. Have you ever ridden one? Shutu smiles shyly, he reaches out to touch the handlebar Vikram flicks his hand away.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Aye, don’t touch her. Mimi comes and sits on the bike and holds Vikram.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: You never minded me touching her. Vikram laughs and revs the engine. Nandu comes back out a raises his eyebrows at the sight of Mimi on the bike hold Vikram. Vikram looks a little uncomfortable.  64 64.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: (in a low voice) Come on Mimi, get off. Mimi looks at Vikram but he doesn’t meet her eyes. Mimi g off.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Move back. Vikram moves back as Nandu sits in front. NANDU (CONT’D) Shutu lock the door. I have the keys.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Oh. Okay Dada. As Nandu rides the bike out of the driveway. Mimi goes in the house past Shutu as he watches the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mimi pours herself a drink at the bar. Shutu is clearing the chess pieces near a dying fire. Mimi sits down in an armchair.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: So who was winning?

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Me! Shutu smiles at her and goes back to putting the pieces a Mimi looks at Shutu moodily for a few moments.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: You’re so pretty, you could be a girl. Shutu looks at her with an unsure smile.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. MCCLUSKIEGUNJ HOUSE - SHUTU’S ROOM . NIGHT 64. A Shutu is unable to sleep while a train rushes by in the distance.  65 65. 65. 66 50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exterior shot of the house at night from the gate. A dog howls in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a long shot, Maniya enters the gate on his cycle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maniya keeps a few letters on the dining table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fade in. Shutu and Tani sits inside an old bathtub, readi book. The super reads Day 4/Thursday (30th DECEMBER) In a corner is Maniya’s hut, in front of it, a vegetable patch and some chickens. Manjari is filling out the bucke The clothes on the line, gently flutter in the breeze. Th two dogs are sleeping curled up in the sun. Maniya enters backyard and resumes his work. Suddenly, the mesh door opens and Brian comes out from th kitchen explaining something with a lot of enthusiasm. He followed by Mimi, Vikram, Nandu and Bonnie who come out w a great deal of energy and bustle.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: But there is so much space! We’1l just draw two lines here.. There is 1, 2, 3...

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: I’m telling you there’s not enough people for kabaddi.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Why? Shutu will also play with us.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: Challo, then we might as well take Tani also to play. Tani and Shutu exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Arrey Maniya can also play. Maniya, kabhi khela hain kabbadi?

dialogues.speaker: MANIYA
dialogues.text: Haa khela hain.  51.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Challo good. Aa jao. Manjari tum bhi.

dialogues.speaker: MANIYA
dialogues.text: Lekin ee lakdi...

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Arrey chodo lakdi yaar.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Bonnie, you and I can’t be in the same team.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Ya all bad players can’t be on one side. Vikram, you and Brian be captains.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: Okay. I choose Nandu.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Hang on! Let’s flip a coin.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: Heads. Nandu flips the coin and its lands on heads.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I choose Nandu.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Maniya, mere team mein.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: MIMI, come over here.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Bonnie, you come over here! Vikram looks between Shutu and Manjari, the two players l planning his strategy. Shutu makes a move to get up. Tani gives him an apprehensive look. Shutu winks at her.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: I choose Manjari. The others laugh at Vikram’s choice. Shutu, realizing tha hasn’t been chosen by Vikram, walks towards Brian. Brian his arm around Shutu.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Come on Shutu... You can play na? A line is drawn and game begins in a fun and playful mood Tani gets into the bathtub and pretends to be the referee  67 67. 68 69 52. Brian is the first player to raid Vikram’s court. Brian begins chanting “kabaddi-kabaddi” and moves rapidly towar their baulk line. At one point Brian swiftly touches Mimi runs toward the mid line. Mimi manages to grab him by his shirt, clings on to his neck and hangs off his back. Bria walks back into his court seemingly oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? What! Something on me? Everyone laughs. Shutu starts playing really well. He is cheered on by everyone, particularly by Mimi and Bonnie.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well done Shuts!

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: (Rubbing VIKRAM’s slight belly) Ooh Vikram, losing your touch huh! This makes Shutu a little cocky and he provokes Vikram wi his tactics. Vikram notices this and tries to ignore it b when it is his turn to raid Brian’s team he becomes fierc competitive. Vikram commits a minor foul against Shutu bu aggressively convinces others through sheer volume that h isn’t in the wrong. The mood of the game becomes very ten

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunty comes out from her bath and finds mail kept on the dining table. She picks up the mail and goes through them walking back. INT. MCCLUSKIEGUNJ HOUSE - AUNTY’S ROOM . DAY 67. A She sits at her desk and picks up the letter opener to op letter. She settles down to read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is Shutu’s turn to tackle VIKRAM’s team. Shutu touches Vikram and leaps ahead toward the mid line. Vikram tackle him with all his force.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. AUNTY’S ROOM. DAY. 69 Aunty is disturbed by what she is reading. The noises fro outside gradually increase, distracting her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vikram has Shutu pinned down. In an effort to get away Sh hits Vikram’s face. This sets Vikram off and the tackle g out of hand. The scuffle causes the dogs to start barking Tani starts crying. Shutu splits his lip in the midst of this.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: What is going on! Break it up now!

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: VIKRAM, stop it!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. AUNTY’S ROOM. DAY. 71 Aunty walks out with an urgency because of the loud commo from outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian tries to break up the fight but Shutu somehow manag to wriggle out of Vikram’s vice like grip, tries to kick in the groin but misses. Furious with Shutu’s audacity, Vikram comes back after him in a fit of rage. Aunty walks out into the backyard from the mesh door. Shutu’s lip bleeds profusely and everyone goes over to hi Mimi is the only one who rushes to Vikram.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: What is going on over here? Maniya! Kya ho raha hain yaha? Maniya goes back to his work. Manjari follows suit giving Vikram a dirty look. Bonnie goes to comfort Tani and take her inside. AUNTY (CONT’D) (Looking accusingly at Nandu) Oh God look at how much he’s bleeding! Come, come inside. Let me have a look. She ushers Shutu in, glances back at Vikram and shakes he head disapprovingly. We stay with the group outside. Nandu takes in the scene walks back inside, spitting.  73 74 54. Vikram notices this as he breathes heavily, trying to get grip on himself. He dismissively brushes Mimi’s hand off.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. AUNTY’S BATHROOM. DAY 73 Shutu is sitting on the commode with the lid on, next to sink. He is frowning and panting with a fixed, faraway lo Aunty opens a cabinet placed over the white enamel sink. takes out a bottle of Dettol and some cotton as she obser Shutu.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Aaj ke ma’r kaaj teke chiti peyechi. I got your mother’s letter today. Shutu breathes heavy and doesn’t react. AUNTY (CONT’D) Kal ke post office giye, maa ke ekta phone korish. Go to the post office and call her tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: (Distractedly) Keno? Why? Aunty bends down to dress the wound, takes her time to answer. Shutu winces in pain as the Dettol stings him.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Dara, ek minute... Hold still...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nandu, Bonnie, Mimi, Shutu and Tani sit at the dining tab silently eating their lunch. Manjari brings in more rotis Aunty serves it to them. Uncle saunters in wearing a hat joins them at the table.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE
dialogues.text: Arrey. Brian aur Vikram kaha gaye?

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: They had to leave.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE
dialogues.text: Oh.  75 55. Uncle stretches across to take some salad and notices Shu

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shutu! Yeh kya hua? Everyone remains silent. Shutu looks up for a moment but doesn’t respond.

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: They were playing Kabbadi...

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: You know how it is. Boys will be boys! Tani looks at her grandmother curiously. Everyone eats in uncomfortable silence.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. VERANDAH STEPS. NIGHT, (LOAD SHEDDING)
dialogues.text: Nandu sits on the verandah steps, smoking a cigarette. Bo walks out with a lantern. She sits beside Nandu and holds her hand for the cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: (Passing the cigarette) She’s asleep?

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Hmm. (Taking a drag) Vikram’s one hot headed guy.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: He’s always been like that.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Ya but he needs to pick on people his own size you know. Not a kid like Shutu.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Please, 23 is hardly a kid! We got married at that age.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: But the problem is that Vikram behaves like he’s 23! And always gets away with it. They smoke in silence as Bonnie swats bugs away. The ligh go off inside the house.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: He does tend to get carried away.  76 56.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Even that day during the planchet, you guys took it too far. It was quite cruel.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: (Looks back at her sharply) You were also a part of it.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Ya, but it was your plan... You know, he’s such a sensitive boy. Nandu rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How he’s been wearing mesho’s sweater everyday.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Kids lose their parents when they are 7,8,9... He’s a full grown man now.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: But give him some time...

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: He needs to toughen up now and take care of his mother. Nandu gets up, stubs out the cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Trust me. Nandu walks off leaving Bonnie outside, he bangs the door he goes in.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. BONNIE’S ROOM. NIGHT 76 Bonnie, Nandu and Tani are asleep. There is a sudden soun Nandu wakes up with a frown. He looks over at Bonnie who fast asleep. Hearing the sound again he goes towards the bathroom. He finds Shutu inside, wedged in a corner, stuc between a cupboard, a door and the wall. Shutu looks ahea scared and disoriented.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: (Whispers) Shutu, what happened? Shutu stares at him blankly.  77 78 78. 57. NANDU (CONT’D) It’s okay, come. Nandu puts his arm around Shutu’s shoulder and leads him to his bed. He tucks the mosquito net back in. Nandu goes through the bathroom towards his own room when spots the frog under the sink. He registers this with a f and walks away, carefully shutting the door behind him. A close shot of the frog staring balefully into the camer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exterior shot of the house taken from the gate. Fireflies hover in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
