dialogues.text: Fade in. On music we see the following visuals. Shutu rides through the quiet, early morning roads of McCluskiegunj on a cycle. Tani sits in front of him. The landscape progresses from stark to the busier market area near the Railway Station. They pass by the market and sto the Post office around the bend. The super reads Day 5/Friday (31st DECEMBER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tani sits on a bench and watches Shutu as he talks to the post man at a counter. Shutu removes a small phone book a shows a number to the post man.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Yeh number pe phone lagana hain.

dialogues.speaker: POSTMAN
dialogues.text: Theek hain. Baitho. He comes to Tani and waits with her until the postman cal him back. POSTMAN (CONT’D) Bardhaman ka number. Aaj jao!  79 79. 58. The post man hands Shutu the phone. On his face, the phon rings twice and he keeps the receiver back down. The post gives him a puzzled look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shutu walks through the corridor leading to the kitchen, carrying the shopping bags. Tani runs ahead of him.

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: Mama, we’ve come back! Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Hi baby! Had fun in the market? Tani goes to her mother while Shutu goes on into the kitc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shutu places the shopping bags down on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Ma’ke phone korli? Called your mother?

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Connect holo na. Phoneta monehoy kharaap. It didn’t. The phone must be dead. Aunty gives Shutu a suspicious look.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Kaal ke aar ek baar cheshta korish. Try once again tomorrow. Bonnie enters. She looks into the bag to take the mutton

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Maa, should we start with the mutton?

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Yes. You know where everything is na? Otherwise ask Manjari. I’m going in for a bath. (Opening the mesh door to the backyard) Manjari paani de do andar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manjari hangs the clothes on the line when she hears Aunt call out to her. Maniya goes to pick up a bucket of water from the under the sun.

dialogues.speaker: MANJARI
dialogues.text: E sab ja payega kha?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shutu and Tani are lying on their stomachs, on the grass outside. Shutu is focusing a point of light through a magnifying glass on a piece of paper. A couple of ants cr across it. Shutu chases a big ant with the magnifying gla trying to focus the point of light on it. Tani watches, fascinated. The puppy is playing near them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bonnie is frying the spices and onions in a large wok on stove. Mimi is chopping potatoes at the counter.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: So who’s this slut Vikram has married? Bonnie rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Isn't she much younger than him?

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Ma was saying that she is from some small town. And you know the small town mentality na... they get their girls married off really young.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: What’s her name?

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Pratima? No Purnima.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Khasi?

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. From that side only.  84 60.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: You saw the new jeep?

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: For them Vikram is royalty!

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Royalty my ass. (Pause) What time are they coming tonight?

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Uh. 7, 7:30 I think. Pass the tomatoes.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: I haven't cut it yet. I’m still on the aloo.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Why have you cut them so small? They’11l melt in the gravy.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: But you didn’t say! We can always fry it separately and add it in the end.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: But then it doesn’t absorb any flavor! Anyway, leave it now. Chop the tomatoes for me fast.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: (Irately) Fine. How do you want it?

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Well ideally I’d like it pureed.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Well obviously I can’t puree it for you now.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Just chop it finely. Hurry up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The paper catches fire and with it so does the grass and ant on it. Shutu and Tani watch the ant burn to a crisp curiously. Tani and Shutu exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: It’s dead na?  85 61.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: I guess.

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: What do we do? Shutu collects the ant and the burnt debris and pretends bury it. Tani does the sign of a cross. Shutu also does i to humour her. Tani arranges a few wild flowers on the pi

dialogues.speaker: TANI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Should I say a poem?

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Sure. Tani folds her hands together in an elocution pose and recites an unrelated, pithy poem.

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: When I was one, I had just begun. When I was two, I was nearly new. When I was three, I was hardly me. When I was four, I was not much more. When I was five, I was just alive. But now I am six, I'm as clever as clever. So I think I'll be six now and forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PURNIMA (25), Vikram’s Assamese wife, confidently sings a beautiful Bihu song oblivious to her surroundings. She lo like a new bride; wearing a mekhla chador, wedding bangle and a thick line of sindoor. She’s unsophisticated, yet s Tani sits next to her, watching her adoringly and occasionally touching her chador. Bonnie motions Tani not disturb Purnima. Tani flatly refuses. Over Purnima’s shoulder, we see Nandu, Shutu, Mrs McKenzi and Uncle who is smoking a cigar. Everyone is sitting aro her, immersed in the song. Aunty is pleasantly surprised, she exchanges an approving look with Bonnie. Vikram accompanies Purnima on a guitar. Mimi is sizing her up, while sipping her third drink. Pur finishes the song, everyone starts to clap.  85. 86 62.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Wow! We had no idea you sing so well?

dialogues.speaker: MRS MCKENZIE
dialogues.text: Have you been learning for long love?

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: (To VIKRAM) Why have you been hiding her all this time?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE
dialogues.text: Challo ek aur gaana ho jaye. Purnima, come on!

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: Sing that one na...

dialogues.speaker: PURNIMA
dialogues.text: No thank you! Abh koi aur gao.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Ya, let’s have a faster song! A fun one we can dance to! Bonnie sings ‘Dhitang Dhitang Bole’ with others joining i Brian joins along on his harmonica. Vikram plays the drum a table. Nandu picks up Tani and dances with her. Uncle a Aunty try a jive; Vikram and Purnima do a twist. Shutu si alone on the sofa, trying to look busy with a magazine. M pulls him up. She dances provocatively and being a little high, trips on her sari twisting her ankle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vikram puts a cassette in the player and presses play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunty and Bonnie arrange the mats and cutlery on the tabl Manjari brings in a casserole and places it down. In the background, the music continues.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Manjari, mutton ke liye bada chamach leke aao.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Ma should we serve Tani here... Bonnie looks at Aunty who is looking at Mimi across the r She looks in that direction as well.  87 63. Mimi is leaning over and talking to Vikram, while casuall touching his thigh. Purnima is next to Vikram, but is tal to Uncle. Mimi giggles, unaware that her pallu has slippe off.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Just look at how she carries on.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Ma, she’s just talking... Vikram looks uncomfortable and gets up. Mimi continues to her drink alone.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Yes. With her sari hanging off? No wonder that boy didn’t marry her.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Well, she can’t help it if men are attracted to her.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: But you can’t deny that she enjoys the attention.

dialogues.speaker: MRS MCKENZIE
dialogues.text: (walking up to them) Everything smells so lovely Anu.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: (Handing her a plate) Please start Aunty Gwen. Guys, dinner is ready!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The older people and Tani are seated at the dining table while Nandu, Shutu, Mimi, Vikram and Purnima sit on the s with their plates. Bonnie is serving herself at the table

dialogues.speaker: MRS MCKENZIE
dialogues.text: I just love this typical Bengali mutton curry!

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: It’s the potatoes, they soak up the flavour. Bonnie made it, you know!

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Thank you! Actually, Mimi and I made it together.  64.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: (Giving a drunken salute) Oh please! I was just following orders. Bonnie gives Mimi a look. Tani leaves her half eaten food goes and sits on Purnima’s lap. Purnima is talking to Shu Vikram is sitting opposite them.

dialogues.speaker: PURNIMA
dialogues.text: Yahan pe kya hua? Vikram looks up sharply from his plate.

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: You know they were fighting? Tani looks at Vikram.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: (Laughs awkwardly) Oh yeh? Kuch nahi, kuch nahi. Purnima turns his face with her hand to get a better look the wound. Mimi gets up to put her plate away.

dialogues.speaker: PURNIMA
dialogues.text: Dikhao toh? Tch tch. Yeh toh ghaav ho gaya hain.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Nahi... Woh khelte khelte lag gaya.

dialogues.speaker: PURNIMA
dialogues.text: Cold compress lagana chahiye. Pata hain, usse bahut help hota hain. Vikram coughs, uneasy at this exchange.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: (Interrupts them) So pretty your payals are Purnima! Sone ke payal bahut kum dekhe hain humne. Vikram notices as Mimi returns and perches herself on the of the sofa next to Shutu. Purnima speaks a mix of Hindi broken English.

dialogues.speaker: PURNIMA
dialogues.text: Hain na? Vikram ke naani ke the. Aaj kal yeh design nahi milte hain.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Really! Wow.  65.

dialogues.speaker: PURNIMA, (HINDI)
dialogues.text: Hajoor ke yaha, sone ke payal ka rivaaj hain.

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: What is rivaaj?

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Oh I didn’t know that. How interesting.

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: Mama, what is rivaaj??

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Shh... grown ups are talking.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Tani, it’s a practice.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Obviously, gold is so expensive that once only royalty could afford it.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Even the men used to wear jewelry, earrings for example.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: (Touching Shutu’s shoulder) I think earrings will really suit you VIKRAM.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Yeah. He looks like a bandit already.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: Ma got so excited that I was finally getting her a bahuri that she’s giving away whatever little family jewels are left also!

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Well, it seems you’re not taking very good care of YOUR family jewels, VIKRAM.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Ya! Wasn't it just yesterday that you were close to losing your manhood, bugger? (Turning to Purnima) I’m sorry ha.. I know we’ve just met, but I’m saying for your sake only.  88 66.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: We're just concerned about the royal heir. We don’t want the family to go into further decline.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: What Vikram really needs is a chastity belt. At least Purnima can breathe easy when she’s away.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Everyone laughs. Purnima hasn’t followed the conversation completely but laughs sportingly.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Ya! Plus it’1ll protect the family jewels!

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Perfect! A golden chastity belt for Vikram!

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Hear! Hear! Everyone raises their glasses, laughing. Bonnie notices a Mimi, laughing helplessly, slips off the arm of the sofa collapses on Shutu’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bonnie places a beautiful caramel custard on the table an clears away other dishes. Tani, by now cranky and sleepy, hangs on to her mother’s palloo.

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: No, you come. You come with me.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Uff Tani. I’m doing some work. Tani continues whining and being clingy as Shutu and Purn come with their empty plates.

dialogues.speaker: PURNIMA
dialogues.text: Kaha pe rakhein?

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Arrey, ho gaya? Tum ne toh kuch khaya hi nahi. Yaha par rakh do.  67.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Tani, come with me. I'll show you something.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Go na! Go with Shutu. Shutu takes Tani out of the room. Vikram, meanwhile, come to Purnima and wipes his wet hands on her chador.

dialogues.speaker: PURNIMA
dialogues.text: Arrey, towel nahi mila bathroom mein? Vikram walks away, laughing. Mimi notices this resentfull

dialogues.speaker: PURNIMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sure kuch help nahi chahiye?

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: No, no don’t worry. It’s nothing. Sit na. Mimi will help me. Mimi? Mimi walks over to Bonnie. They step outside the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the corridor, Bonnie pulls Mimi aside and whispers.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Just what do you think you’re doing?

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Why? What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Can you be a little more dignified?

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: He’s a married man now.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: So tell him. I’m not the one who's married.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: How many drinks have you had? Mimi gives her look.  90 91 68.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have you had dinner?

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: I’m fine. Don’t worry about me. Mimi makes a move to go. They hear Nandu.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Bonnie! Where are you? Mimi uses this moment to get away. Bonnie follows her.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. BONNIE’S ROOM. NIGHT 90 Tani has fallen asleep with her doll clutched in one hand Shutu, too, has nodded off beside her but is suddenly wok up by loud cheering and a countdown to midnight. He walks the door and finds everyone hugging and wishing each othe Happy New Year. Aunty sees Shutu at the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Where were you? Happy New Year beta!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is wishing each other. Mrs. McKenzie hugs Brian.

dialogues.speaker: MRS MCKENZIE
dialogues.text: (Wiping away a tear) Happy New Year dear. God knows where you'll be next year...

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Everyone is going away Gwen... Only we oldies are left. (hugging Gwen)

dialogues.speaker: PURNIMA
dialogues.text: Happy New Year Uncle!

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE
dialogues.text: (To Purnima) Happy New Year bahuri! Yeh badmash pareshan kare toh batana, tight kar denge usko. They all break into Auld Lang Syne. Vikram laughs, turns away and has an awkward exchange wit Mimi. Making sure Vikram is watching, Mimi gives Shutu an overly intimate embrace.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: 92 93 94 95 96 69. INT. BONNIE’S ROOM. NIGHT 92 Auld Lang Syne continues - Shot of Tani sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Auld Lang Syne continues - Maniya and Manjari eat, sittin the floor. Manjari shares her food with the puppy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Auld Lang Syne continues - A shot of left over caramel custard, empty glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shutu is alone in the darkened room, locking the door. He turns around at a sudden movement. Mimi has come and stoo behind the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Arrey! Party’s over? She makes her way to the armchair and sits down with a gr and opens her hair.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Can I get you some water?

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Can you get me another drink instead?

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: (Laughs ) Of course! You were having Rum? As Shutu walks over to the bar, Mimi massages her ankle. Shutu watches her as he makes her drink. Mimi doesn’t tak the glass, so Shutu puts it down on the table next to her

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: I think I may have twisted my ankle. See?  97 70. Shutu tries to hold her ankle gently but hurts her inadvertently.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ow!

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Oh! Sorry, sorry.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: (Laughs ) It’s okay, Shutu! An awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: You have beautiful feet!

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: (Making a sad face) But I don’t have any golden payals! Mimi looks at him contemplatively as he attempts to rotat her ankle. She takes a moment before she makes a move to up.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I better go to bed.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Oh okay. Shutu makes a move to help her get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mimi and Shutu walk down the corridor. She is a little unsteady on her feet and has her arm around Shutu’s shoul Shutu’s arm is around her waist. He is holding her shoes his other hand.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: (Squeals) You have such cold hands Shutu!

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: I know. I’m sorry. They proceed awkwardly, shuffling and giggling as they he to Mimi’s room.

INT. MIMI’S BEDROOM. NIGHT. 98 Shutu looks at the bed but chooses to sit her down on Unc chair instead. As he reaches the chair, she deliberately stops and turns to look at him. Mimi locks eyes with Shutu for a moment before pushing hi down on to the chair. Shutu sits down, stunned. She lifts sari a little and sits astride him. Lowering her face to Shutu’s, she kisses him and then starts opening his belt. Shutu’s hands grip the arms of the chair tightly, his knuckles whitening. He starts breathing heavily as he clo his eyes and kisses her back. We move behind the chair and see the back of Shutu’s head Mimi’s hair cascading down. She grips the back of the cha firmly with one hand. The camera pans down the length of the chair as it starts rock gently. There is a bit of folded newspaper wedged un one of the legs. As the chair starts to move faster, the paper slips out. The sound of the wooden leg against the floor becomes faster and louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shutu walks across the corridor to his room. There is gen snoring from the other rooms. INT. SHUTU’S ROOM. NIGHT. 99 Shutu reaches his room, shuts the door behind him and get into bed. The puppy tries to jump on to the bed. Shutu sc him up under the blanket. His eyes shine brightly as he cuddles the puppy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exterior shot of the house at night.

dialogues.text: 101 102 103 104 72. INT. MIMI’S BEDROOM. DAY. 101 Fade in. There is bright sunlight on Mimi’s face as she o her heavily kohl smudged eyes. She sees the time on the w clock: 11:45. The super reads Day 6/Saturday (1st JANUARY) MIMI’s hair is dishevelled and she is still wearing last night’s clothes. She is severely hung over as she sits up disoriented, holding her head. She sees her sari on the s chair and cringes, suddenly remembering everything with a groan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mimi opens her door a crack and peeps out apprehensively. is wearing fresh clothes and her face is scrubbed clean o last night’s makeup. Her hair is pulled back into a sober ponytail. She walks gingerly down the corridor and goes t the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mimi pours and drinks a whole glass of water. She notices empty breakfast plates in the sink. She walks over to the stove, lifts the lid off the wok and picks up remnants of bhurji to eat. Bonnie walks in, notices Mimi.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: There’s more kept on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Oh, okay.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Happy New Year!

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Happy New Year!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle sits on a rocking chair, holding a transistor to hi ear as he follows a cricket match. Tani is sitting and coloring on the floor. Fluffy is attacking the crayons.  73.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Okay, 20 across, actress in a best- selling swimsuit poster. 7 letters. Shutu? Shutu, with a prominent black eye, is rapidly solving the Rubik’s cube with clicking sounds. He stops and looks up Mimi walks out with a cup of tea and her book. He has fin changed out of the green sweater he has been wearing everyday. NANDU (CONT’D) Well. Good afternoon Mimi! Mimi gives him a withering look and plants a kiss on Uncl forehead.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Happy New Year Uncle! Mimi happens to sit down next to Shutu on the cane two seater.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE
dialogues.text: Good morning. Happy New Year!

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Slept well?

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Not really.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Really? It’s only 12. You want to go sleep some more? Mimi ignores Nandu’s remark. Mimi meanwhile takes out a cigarette from the box lying on the table. The matchbox i little further away, towards Shutu. Mimi looks at Shutu expectantly. Shutu looks back at Mimi; nervous and uncomprehending. Over these visuals Nandu and Uncle’s conversation continues.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Sophia Loren!

dialogues.speaker: NANDU, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Noooo... that’s too long. 7 letters. Aah! Bo Derek.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: (Raising her eyebrows to signal) Match? Shutu stares at her blankly. Mimi is amused. In the background, Tani’s eyes dart between the two. Mimi leans across Shutu to pick up the matchbox herself.  105 106 74.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Oh Shutu you’11 know this one! The high pitch of a loud siren drops as it moves past it’s observer. This is the dash effect. Shutu who was staring at mimi, turns almost by reflex.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Doppler.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Yes! Mimi raises her eyebrows at Shutu and smiles, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: (Cheers loudly) Yes! Out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shutu anxiously fidgets with the rubik’s cube. He notices Mimi who walks out to the verandah with her writing mater and sits. Shutu’s gaze follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shutu walks purposefully across the backyard and goes tow the motorcycle. He walks the bike across towards the fron lawns. Tani runs towards him.

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: Shutu! Shutu! Shutu pretends not to hear her. She comes up to him.

dialogues.speaker: TANI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Out of the breath) Shutu!

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Tani!

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Shutu is silent.

dialogues.speaker: TANI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where are we going?  107 75. Shutu is still walking quietly as Tani prattles on.

dialogues.speaker: TANI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know how to drive a motor cycle?

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Ya. I know how to ride a motor cycle.

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: But you can’t drive a car! Shutu laughs. Tani walks along.

dialogues.speaker: TANI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I will sit in the front. You sit behind me because baba said that if I sit behind, I'll fall off.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: I can’t ride as well as your baba. I’m only practicing. When I learn properly then you come with me.

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: Baba allowed you?

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: (Stops and turns to her) Tani where’s Fluffy gone?

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: I don’t know. He must be inside.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Go look for him. Bonnie di will get angry if he runs off again.

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: Okay, I’1l go and get him. You wait for me haan? Don’t go without me, okay?

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Ya. Tani runs off inside while Shutu makes off hurriedly in t other direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mimi uses her book to shade her eyes from the sun. She is almost asleep. A sudden movement makes Mimi open her eyes She lifts the book a little and squints into the distance  108 109 76. With Mimi’s brightly painted toenails in the foreground, see Shutu approaching, awkwardly walking the bike. Mimi l amused. As he comes closer, Shutu gives her a shy smile and looks away as he keeps walking determinedly. His hair falls ove his black eye that has now turned an ugly purple. He trie move it with a jerk of his head. He comes up to her and stands there, slightly out of breath.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Hi. Mimi smiles at him. SHUTU (CONT’D) Want to go for a ride?

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Only if you let me ride it.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. SHUTU’S ROOM. DAY. 108 Tani walks into Shutu’s room. It is a small room with his things strewn around. The room is dark, the curtains are drawn. Shutu’s books, his clothes, a pack of cigarettes, shaving kit are lying messily on the bed. Tani rifles thr his things, picks up his shaving brush and strokes it thoughtfully on her chin. The puppy squiggles out from th basket and comes near Tani’s feet. She scoops up the pupp placing the brush back exactly as it was and runs back ou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tani comes out of the front door and walks into the veran talking all the while.

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: Shutu see I found him! He was under your bed. Should we take him also? Tani doesn’t see Shutu. She walks down the verandah steps looks around for him. She finds Shutu and Mimi walking th motorcycle out of the driveway and looks on disbelievingl

dialogues.speaker: TANI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shutu! Shutu! Wait... Tani runs down the driveway, with the puppy in her arms.  110 111 77.

dialogues.speaker: TANI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (On the verge of tears) Shutu! Tani sets the puppy down. On her face, we hear the motorc speed away. A labourer, working on the boundary wall, tur around in the direction of the sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shutu looks a little distracted as Mimi rides the bike. S awkwardly holds the seat for support. Mimi is enjoying th wind in her hair. They ride through the lonely lanes of t Gunj. She stops the bike, gets off and enters the gate of McCluskiegunj cemetery.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Wait, where are you going? Mimi turns around shading her eyes from the sun with her hand.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: (With a smile) Come? Without waiting for a response, Mimi goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shutu catches up with Mimi who has stopped at a graveston

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Mrs. Gladys McGowan. Arrived on 18th July 1897. Departed on 12th August 1958. She left even as she had tried to live in grace and beauty.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: (Slightly out of breath) Why are we here? Mimi looks at him and smiles. SHUTU (CONT’D) I thought we could go to the stream up ahead.  78.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: We could... (Distracted by something) Isn’t that Curney? Shutu squints into the distance. In a long shot, Mrs. Curney is kneeling at a grave furthe away.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mrs. Curney! The woman turns her face to them partially, then gets up walks away.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mrs. Curney? (Turning back) Is she ignoring us?

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Mimi, Mimi... Let her be...(Following Mimi) Is that even her? Mimi approaches the grave Mrs. Curney was at. She finds a candle, flowers arranged in the shape of a heart and something wrapped in a paper napkin.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Elizabeth Curney. Born 1959 - Died 1965. (Gasps) Only 6 years old! Mimi’s eyes travel down to the candle. She runs her hands over the flower arrangement. Lifting the napkin, she find slice of cake and looks delighted.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Want?

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: (Horrified)

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: How can you eat it? It was lying... there!

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: She just left it! You’re always so proper Shutu. It’s very boring.  112 79.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: But it’s not meant for us!

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Who is it meant for? Elizabeth Curney? Mimi breaks off a bit of the cake and forces a little int Shutu’s mouth. He tries to resist but ends up eating a bi it. Mimi laughs mischievously.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Walking away) Delicious, isn’t it? Shutu spits and wipes his mouth. He looks further ahead t check if Mrs. Curney is still there.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: What if she comes back? Shutu doesn’t get a response. He turns around but can’t s Mimi. From between a tree and the back of some gravestone we see Shutu as he looks around apprehensively. SHUTU (CONT’D)

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: (Looks around)

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Shutu walks away from the gravestone and looks further in distance. He stands alone for a few chilling moments. SHUTU (CONT’D) Mimi, we have to return Vikram’s bike also. Mimi suddenly jumps out from behind the tree and pounces him.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: (Covering his eyes, Exorcist voice) I’m the ghost of Elizabeth Curney. I suck cock in hell! Shutu jumps out of his skin. Mimi collapses into giggles. Suddenly, Shutu pins her against the tree and aggressivel starts to kiss her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tani has curled up in the cane chair. She is sulking. Man passes by with a pile of clothes in her hands - a blur in background. Tani notices the crayons rolling around. She frowns and sits up.

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: Fluffy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long shot of Manjari folding clothes in a quiet corner the kitchen. We follow her as she takes the pile of folde laundry from room to room. Manjari goes to Mimi’s room first. The door is ajar, the is empty. She enters and keeps the pile down on the bed. Next she comes to Aunty’s room and finds the door left op She walks in and finds Aunty sleeping alone, in the same position as we saw her last. She leaves a few clothes on dresser and exits. Finally, Manjari comes to Bonnie’s room and knocks on the door. There’s no response.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. BONNIE’S ROOM. DAY 115 Nandu is sitting on the bed with his eyes closed. He hear the knock and opens his eyes in alarm. He hears the knock again and there’s a sound as a hand tries to open the doo He freezes.

dialogues.speaker: MANJARI, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Didi Kapde! Bonnie who was going down on Nandu under a sheet, pops he head out for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Bahar rakhdo. She goes back under the sheet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle opens the tool box and systematically lays out all components.  117 118 119 81. He sets down the bottle of linseed oil and on a leather c begins to dismantle the rifle. Maniya walks up to Uncle, holding a rusty, battered drum cover with a few old bulle holes and a thick layer of dust on it.

dialogues.speaker: MANIYA
dialogues.text: Yeh wala?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE
dialogues.text: (Inspecting it) Kya haal bana ke rakha hain iska. Saaf karo! Vikram pulls up on the jeep.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. INSIDE BONNIE’S ROOM. DAY 117 Hearing Vikram’s jeep, Nandu gets up and buckles his belt Bonnie snuggles under the sheet and curls up for a snooze Nandu burps loudly and goes into the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shutu is blissfully lying on the grass, half asleep. Mimi hooks her bra strap shut from under her sweater. She frow into the distance to check if anyone has seen them.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: (brusquely) Hurry up! Let’s get back before it gets dark. As they walk away, we tilt down to see that he has writte ‘Shutu + Mimi’

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a series of a fast paced shots we see Shutu riding the motorcycle, Mimi sitting behind him. Shutu wobbles a litt on the bike while Mimi laughs at his struggle. They look relaxed and happy. This is intercut with Tani’s running f We hear her call out to Fluffy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 120 INT. BONNIE’S ROOM. DAY 120 Bonnie opens her eyes with a start. She sits up and feels chill in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manjari is putting away dishes in the cabinet. Bonnie wal in and fills a kettle with water at the sink.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Manjari, Tani kahan hain?

dialogues.speaker: MANJARI
dialogues.text: Bahar pilla ke saath khel raha tha. Bonnie puts the kettle on the stove.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Chai bahar bhej dena. Vikram bhi aaye huye hai. Aur Tani ke liye bournvita.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nandu and Vikram are with Uncle at the verandah. Vikram stands next to Uncle and observes Uncle’s elaborate ritua

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: Smithandweson ka 32. It’s a snubnose uncle. Kal leke aaye? Target practice ke liye.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE
dialogues.text: Good idea. Leke aao. Waise uska range 10 meter se zyaada nahi hoga.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Uska 10 meter range hain aur aapka pata nahi chalege ke bhi nahi. Kar lo target practice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunty comes up to the verandah after talking to the labourers.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Vikram beta! Good you’re here. Yeh majdoor log mujhe pagal kar rahe hain. Everyday they come late, if they come at all.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: They are all like this Aunty. I’1l have a word with the thekedar. Bonnie comes out to the verandah and holds the mesh door for Manjari.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Baaki sab ko bulaado. Chai thanda ho jayega. Manjari sets the tea tray down on the table and goes insi Everyone picks up a cup of tea.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is the tea that Purnima got last night. Such a lovely aroma...

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: (noticing Brian walking in through the gate) Isn't that Brian? Manjari ek aur chai!

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: What’s that in his hand? Isn’t that Fluffy? Brian comes up to the verandah steps with Fluffy in his a His own dog, Fluffy’s mother, follows at his heels.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Hey! You guys want to keep this bugger or not? This fellow keeps coming back to his mom all the time...

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: But I thought Tani was playing with Fluffy. She’s not with you?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: No. I found him in the garden with his mother. Manjari comes and stands at the door.  84.

dialogues.speaker: MANJARI
dialogues.text: Ghar pe aur koi nahi hain.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: (Getting up) Koi nahi hain matlab? Mimi room mein nahi hain? Tani? Bonnie goes inside to check. Maniya cycles in from the ga

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Arrey she must be with Shutu.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE
dialogues.text: Abh thand bhi lag rahi hain.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Maniya! Shutu aur Tani ko dekha hain?

dialogues.speaker: MANIYA
dialogues.text: Nahi.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Usko jaake puchon kuch dekha hain ki nahi. (Indicating a passing labourer)

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 125.Pt JEXT. DRIVEWAY. DAY 125.Pt 1 Maniya goes up to the labourer.

dialogues.speaker: MANIYA
dialogues.text: Yaha se koi gaya tha? The labourer gives a vague look.

dialogues.speaker: MANIYA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kisi ko dekha gate se nikalte hue?

dialogues.speaker: LABOURER
dialogues.text: Ek motorcycle gaya tha.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 125.Pt 2XT. VERANDAH. DAY 125.Pt 2 Bonnie has come back out.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Motorcycle pe?  85.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Motorcycle pe kaun gaya? Tani saath mein thi? Nandu looks at him surprised, gets up and goes to check.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: Mimi has also gone with them?

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: She’s nowhere to be seen either.

dialogues.speaker: A EXT. MCCLUSKIEGUNJ HOUSE
dialogues.text: We follow Nandu to the side of the house. He finds the motorcycle is missing.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: They’re here!

dialogues.speaker: B EXT. MCCLUSKIEGUNJ HOUSE
dialogues.text: Nandu runs back to see the motorcycle entering the drivew with Shutu riding and Mimi’s arms around him. They look dishevelled and relaxed, till they realize that everyone' attention is on them. Shutu halts the motorcycle a little away from them and Mi gets off.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Where were you guys?

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Tani is not with you? Shutu looks around and takes it all in.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: (In a small voice) No.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: You didn’t take Tani with you?

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: (Scared) No.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: What happened? Bonnie ignores Mimi.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Then where is she?  86.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Did you see her before leaving? Where was she? Mimi walks towards the verandah. 125 ¢ EXT. MCCLUSKIEGUNJ HOUSE - VERANDAH. DUSK 125 ¢ Brian comes out from inside the house.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Listen Vikram, she’s not in the house.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: (To Vikram) What happened? Where’s Tani? Vikram ignores her.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You guys checked the whole house?

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: Obviously, we’ve checked the whole fucking house. I can’t believe Shutu and you just went off with my bike.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: I wanted to ride the bike, Vikram.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: You could've just informed us if you two wanted to go out.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: (Hysterical) Why didn’t you take her with you?

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: No... we, I mean... I didn’t want to take her without asking you SO...

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Shutu. Where did you see her last?

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: She... she was at home. Playing with Fluffy.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Okay but where?  125 126 127

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Towards the back. Shutu puts the bike stand, struggling with it a little.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: (To Uncle) Aap toh yahi the na? Aapne dekha nahi? Uncle gives Aunty a vague look.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Maniya, pichein theek se jaakar dekho. Tub ke pass. Maniya goes off to check the backyard.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: (To Uncle) Come let’s go inside, it’s getting dark now. You can do this tomorrow. Uncle starts to pack his tool kit and Aunty goes to help As they proceed, the verandah is getting dark. The lights have been switched on inside. We can hear voices calling for Tani. Two cups of tea and a glass of Bournvita remain untouched. The coloring paper flies away from the edge of verandah in the background.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. MCCLUSKIEGUNJ HOUSE. NIGHT. 126
dialogues.text: Shutu looks under the bed in his own room. Mimi opens a cupboard and looks inside. Brian searches the front lawns with a torch. Manjari shines the lantern on the abandoned bathtub. Maniya looks inside the store room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bonnie enters from the corridor and frantically searches room before going outside again. Uncle sits at the dining table, putting his tool kit away while observing the fren around him.  128 129 88.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE
dialogues.text: Iss ghar mein itne logon ke beech mein, ek bachchi gayab ho jaati hain, aur kisi ko pata bhi nahi chalta! Nandu enters the room to change the batteries of the torc Bonnie comes back in and looks behind the cabinets, under tables and in the process almost knocks off a vase.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. SHUTU’S ROOM. NIGHT. 128 Shutu goes to check the bathroom and sees the frog. The f is now closer to the door. On Shutu’s face, we hear a sud loud crash.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU, (0.C)
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing Bonnie?

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: You're just adding to the chaos. Sit still in one place.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Shit, shit... I just didn’t see it... I... I don’t know how.. Bonnie bends down to pick up the broken pieces of a vase. Aunty gets up to help. Nandu gets increasingly frustrated the torch doesn’t work even with the new batteries.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: It’s okay. Let it be. Don’t worry. Just sit down. (Picking up the pieces) If only you had told me once, I would have kept an eye on her.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: But Ma, you were sleeping yourself!

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Yes! Because no body told me the poor girl was going to be left alone.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: I don’t understand. After lunch, we came in to lie down... she went off looking for Shutu... (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I thought he’ll be with her. He didn’t even tell me before going!

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Shutu is a kid, okay? You can’t be counting on him to do your job.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: My job? He’s been with her every day and nobody’s ever had a problem with it before!

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Bonnie, just shut up and let me think! Brian and Vikram come inside and try to break up the figh

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Guys, guys.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Nandu! Calm down. (Turning to Bonnie) Bonnie, Nandu’s right you know. Shutu’s not been himself lately. He never used to get into fights... You know he’s failed his final exams? Bonnie looks up aghast.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: (Whispers) Failed?

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: He’s been thrown out of the hostel, he’s lied to his mother... Bonnie and Nandu exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shutu stands alone in the corridor outside, with his head hung low, listening.  90.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Left her alone in Bardhaman and he’s come on this holiday. And now this. Tell me, is this responsible behavior?

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Guys, guys. Let’s think clearly.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: She's obviously not in the house. Let’s not waste anymore time.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: We have to tell the police.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: You can’t file a police complaint so soon? Can you Baba?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE
dialogues.text: Minimum 24 hours, I think.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: Don’t worry! I’1l talk to Shrivastav. He may be able to help us. Who saw her last?

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: (Turns to Manjari) Manjari. Manjari, kitne baje dekha last?

dialogues.speaker: MANJARI
dialogues.text: Pata nahi... (Turns to Bonnie ) O, kapde dene ke liye aaya tha na? Uss se pehle. Bonnie and Nandu exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: (To VIKRAM) Must be around 4. Just before you came.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: I only came at 4:30 and now it’s almost 6!

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: Listen she’s a little girl. It’s been under two hours. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She couldn’t have gone beyond a two kilometer radius. You guys search the grounds, I’1l go get Ganghju and Khushia na?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Ya. And I‘1l go check at my place first. Brian puts on his jacket and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: I‘11l come with you VIKRAM. Vikram ignores her and exits from the front door. Mimi follows him. Nandu picks up his car keys. Bonnie comes up to Nandu at front door.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: I’m coming with you.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: No. You stay here.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: (Crying) I'll just go mad sitting here and waiting Nandu, please!

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: (Turning around and holding her shoulders) Baby, please stay here with Ma Baba. She might come back on her own and she’1ll want you here. We will find her, okay? Bonnie nods dumbly. She stands at the doorway as everyone leaves. NANDU (0.C.) (CONT’D) Shutu, come on. Get into the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the gate, Vikram’s car speeds off into the distan As the tail lights disappear, darkness closes in once aga

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The headlights of Nandu’s car light up the misty orchard. trees get more dense. As the car slows down, Nandu and Sh roll down their windows and call out for Tani. They get out of the car. Nandu leaves the headlights on, jumps on to the hood of the car to get to a better vantag point. He shines the torch on the thick foliage.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: (Jumping off the car) You go in that direction, I'll take this side. They set off in different directions. The headlights rema on, lighting up the misty landscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manjari and a couple of other Adivasi women search the grounds, calling out to each other in their own language. Holding a lantern, Manjari stomps her stick on the ground she searches for Tani.

dialogues.speaker: MANJARI
dialogues.text: Main bole khojat rahi, lekin nahi bol rahi. MANJARI’S FRIEND Ka?

dialogues.speaker: MANJARI
dialogues.text: Raat ke lombad nikle lani. MANJARI’S FRIEND Ek baar fash gelak rahi jaal main se la dubara nahi aawi. They exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. BRIAN’S HOUSE. NIGHT. 137 Brian is at the stream running by his house. He shines th torch onto the rocks and running water. His voice echoes eerily over the water as he shouts out Tani’s name. Dogs howl as Mrs. McKenzie and Kitty stand at the veranda bundled up in their night clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shutu follows a dirt track in the wilderness. He’s pantin and his nose starts to run in the cold. There is a rustli of dry leaves and broken twigs as he makes his way throug the forest. Eerie bird calls pierce the night. Nandu’s vo wafts through the distance: ‘Taaa-ni!’ There is a sudden movement. Shutu goes in that direction. comes across a little clearing and decides to explore further. He starts walking faster but stops as the torch light illuminates Tani’s discarded belt lying on the fore floor. Shutu stares at it in horror and quickly picks it He thinks Tani must be nearby. He calls out her name repeatedly. In his excitement he trips over a rock and fa into an underground animal trap, letting out a shout. In a wide shot, we see the still forest, nobody is around hear Shutu’s muffled, underground struggle.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Dada!... Dada!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle pours brandy into three glasses. Bonnie paces aroun the room, she opens the front door and hunches up her shoulders to the chilly air.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: (Shutting the door) I don’t even know if she was wearing a sweater. Uncle gives Bonnie a glass. She gulps down in one sip and looks at him gratefully. Aunty is knitting and muttering prayer under her breath. Uncle sits down on the arm chair sips his brandy looking relatively relaxed.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE
dialogues.text: Arrey kitna tension lete ho tum log! Relax karo. Kalidas wapas nahi aane wala hain. (muttering, O.C) Ek kachua ke piche itna hangama. Bonnie stops pacing, looks at him incredulously and then Aunty. Aunty is acutely embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: O.P! You've had too much to drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shutu is sitting still inside the trap. In one hand he ha the torch and in the other, Tani’s belt. There is a sudde rustling sound. Shutu looks up and flashes the torch. The light catches the eyes of a a wild cat, staring down at Shutu. Shutu looks back alert. The cat twitches and walks away. Shutu slowly lets out his breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dogs bark as the moon rises in the forest. Suddenly we he jeep’s horn blaring jubilantly “Pa-pa-pa-pa!”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nandu stops in his tracks as the horn rings through the silence. He looks back in the direction of the house wher the sound seems to be coming from.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Shutu! Shutu!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maniya reacts to the blaring horns and heads back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nandu gets no response from Shutu. He jumps into the car, lowers his window and yells out.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Maniya! Challo vapas!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the trap, Shutu’s crouched in a corner. He hears t blaring horns and Nandu’s calls.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Dada! I’m here. Dada!  146 147 95. His voice gets drowned out by the sound of the horns. Helplessly, he realizes that he can’t be heard as the car drives away. Above the ground, we track away from the spot as Shutu’s voice becomes faint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nandu’s car screeches to a halt as he parks it haphazardl near verandah. He runs in, leaving the car door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nandu finds Bonnie carrying Tani in her arms and kissing repeatedly. Tani is wearing VIKRAM’s jacket. Her dress is torn, her hair is an unruly mess, she has scraped her kne and is bare feet.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: We were coming back from Shrivastav’s house and thank god Vikram decided to check the back road... Nandu grabs Tani in his arms and kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Thank God you're safe! You are NOT to leave the house again!

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Let it be now.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Where did you find her?

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: I don’t know why but I just thought we should check the area near Siyartoli. It is pretty deserted back there. And guess what? We find Bahadur carrying Tani in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Who’s Bahadur?

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: He works for Goswami. He was going home after work and found her.  96.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: He said he was taking her to the doctor’s house.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: But Goswami and all are in Cal.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: She had wandered onto their grounds apparently. Main thing is that we found her.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE
dialogues.text: We'll talk to Goswami.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Just do that... Tch. Bechara, Khide peyeche nishchoi? Manjari! (Turning to Manjari) Khana laga do sabh ke liye. Ho jayega na? Aunty is about to turn away.

dialogues.speaker: MANJARI
dialogues.text: Par Shutu Bhaiya toh nahi aaya.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: (Irritated) Nahi aaya matlab? Maniya ko bhejo bulaane.

dialogues.speaker: . AEXT. MCCLUSKIEGUNJ GROUNDS
dialogues.text: Shutu, still trapped in the pit, hears Maniya call out to him.

dialogues.speaker: MANIYA, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Shutu! Shutu bhaiya!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maniya, flashes his torch and makes his way through with stick.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: (Muffled) Maniya! Maniya! Idhar. Maniya looks around but can’t see anyone. He goes in the direction of the sound.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Maniya, neeche! Maniya points the torch down, walks slowly until he comes upon the hole. He kneels down and sees Shutu. Maniya gigg with surprise.

dialogues.speaker: MANIYA
dialogues.text: Arrey! Aap ko sabh dhoondh rahe hain aur aap yaha gir gaye. Vikram bhaiya ko mil gaya baby. Shutu stares back at Maniya as Maniya extends his hand to Shutu.

dialogues.speaker: MANIYA, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Challo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shutu stands at the verandah, watching the family inside. clothes are soiled, his face muddy and bruised. A few wil burrs stick to his jeans and shoes. From Shutu’s POV, we see Tani is sitting on Vikram’s lap Bonnie feeding her some hot soup. The rest are around the INT. MCCLUSKIEGUNJ HOUSE - BONNIE’S ROOM. NIGHT 150 Shutu stands at the doorway of Bonnie’s room. Tani is lyi in bed with Bonnie. There is a thermometer in Tani’s mout and Bonnie is putting a cold wash cloth on her forehead. notice him. Shutu limps over to the bed and kneels next to Tani. He reaches out to her but she gives him a scornful look.

dialogues.speaker: TANI
dialogues.text: No! You left me and went. She turns around and buries her face in Bonnie’s shoulder Shutu looks devastated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exterior shot of the house from the gate. Some leaves rus and smoke blows into the air. Shutu stubs his cigarette a walks away. FADE OUT.  152 153 154 155

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fade in. Manjari sweeps the verandah. The super reads Day 7/Sunday (2nd JANUARY)

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. BONNIE’S ROOM. DAY 153 Bonnie wakes up, hugs Tani and goes back to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. MIMI’S BEDROOM. DAY 154 Mimi is fast asleep in her room.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 155
dialogues.text: INT. SHUTU’S ROOM. DAY 155. A Shutu’s room is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maniya washes the lid of the drum with a spray of water f a hose. Shutu watches him from the corridor. Shutu is unslept, has big dark circles and his black eye is deeper than before.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. AUNTY’S ROOM. DAY 157 Uncle is searching for something among Aunty’s things at dressing table. One drawer is locked. Aunty enters with clothes under her arm and is heading to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Abh kya hua? (Irritated)

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE
dialogues.text: Kuch time pe nahi milta hain. Hamesha mera samaan idhar udhar karti rehti ho.  158 159 99.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: (Muttering while walking to the bathroom) You leave my things alone. Uncle turns to see aunty go into the bathroom. He picks u her keys from the bedside table and goes to open the lock drawer. Among a bunch of rollers and other things, he fin small box of ammunition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A close shot of Shutu’s morose face. Aunty is sitting opposite him at the table with her tea in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Tui ekhunu Ma’ke phone korli na, na? Tin din hoye gelo kintu chiti peye. Mimi walks in, freshly bathed, with a damp towel in her h She looks over at the kitchen table. Shutu, who all this while was fidgeting with crumbs, notices Mimi from the co of his eye. Mimi awkwardly looks away while making her coffee. AUNTY (CONT’D) You should go back home Shutu. And better buy your ticket today. First go to the post office and give her a call, then go the station and buy your ticket. Dekh kothaye confirmed seat paash. Shutu looks up at Aunty slowly, glancing at MIMI.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: (low voice) Kintu taka poysha toh neyi... But I don’t have any money. Aunty’s face softens.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Aami diye debo. Tor chokh ta toh roj roj bediye jaache! Ma’r heart fail hoye jaabe. Bhebhe dekhechish? Shekh ta kothai gelo?  160 161

dialogues.speaker: 161A
dialogues.text: 162 163 100. Aunty picks up the hot compress, touches her tea cup with and puts it to his eye. As Aunty tends to his black eye, his other eye Shutu watches Mimi silently leave the kitch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shutu wanders the roads of McCluskiegunj, alone on a cycl He reaches the post office, lost in his own world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shutu is at the counter, listening to his mother as she w on the phone. His eyes are vacant and fixed far away.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU'S MOTHER, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: We can easily get you a teaching position here in Bardhaman. What to do Shutu, we really can’t afford anything else. We track away from the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shutu comes up to a small ticket window.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Howrah ka next train? Shutu takes out his wallet. There is a faded black and wh picture of a man with a child smiling, tucked inside.

dialogues.speaker: TICKET VENDOR, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Howrah? Chopan se Gomoh lijiye. Barkhakana mein Howrah ka bogie lagega.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. SHUTU’S ROOM. DAY 163 Shutu is packing away his meagre belongings into his back pack. He picks up his books strewn over the bed and puts in. From under his books, he finds the magnifying glass. looks at it for a moment and puts it inside his bag.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 164 165 101. INT. AUNTY’S ROOM. DAY 164 Aunty sits at a writing desk near the window in her room. She has filled thin sheets of air mail paper with delicat neat handwriting. She folds the letter carefully, blows o the envelope and puts the letter in. She puts a couple of hundred rupees in as well. As she licks the envelope shut she hears a sound at the door.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: (Without looking) Manjari... She turns around and her expression changes as she finds Shutu standing at the door way. AUNTY (CONT’D) Ticket peli? Shutu walks up to her, handing her the change.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: Yes. Here.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: (Handing the envelope to Shutu) Eta Maa ke diye dish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shutu comes out of Aunty’s room. He walks down the corrid and comes across Mimi who is coming out of the kitchen wi an orange. They pass each other awkwardly searching for something to say.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: You're leaving? Shutu nods.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bardhaman?

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: But I’1l be coming to Cal soon. So I’1ll see you? Mimi looks at him for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Shutu I... I think you should be concentrating on your studies a little more.  166 167 102. She turns and heads out of the door. Shutu takes a moment collect himself as he watches her leave through the mesh door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle spills a little linseed oil as he reaches for the cloth.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE
dialogues.text: Bhenchod! He notices Shutu’s shadowy figure standing behind the mes door.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shutu beta, idhar aao. Shutu joins Uncle outside.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Zara isko ponch do. Shutu wipes as he watches Mimi ahead.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Abh dikhaenge Nandu ko. Box leke aana. Maniya!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shutu and Uncle are in the front lawns. Maniya is holding drum lid against the tree.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE
dialogues.text: Aur upar. Arrey itna nahi. Neechein! Sunai nahi deta kya? Shutu is uninterested.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Aim kabhi aise havein mein nahi karna chahiye, kya pata civillian ko lag jaaye. Box do. Shutu looks around to notice Vikram and Brian enter on th bike from the side of the house. Nandu comes out of the h and Tani runs to him. Bonnie and Mimi join them near the verandah.  103.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Pehle isme mag chadhate hain. Phir safety catch ko ready position mein laate hain. Phir cock karke... The loud cocking sound brings Shutu back to the moment. U is ready to aim.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Foresight ko aperture ke beech mein rakh ke, shifth ko target pe milate hain.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: (pleadingly) Uncle, ek baar please...mujhe. Let me hold it na. (PAUSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aap fire karein usse pehle. Uncle gives him a look and goes back to the rifle.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE
dialogues.text: No, no Shutu. Not now.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: I just want to hold it once, just to see how it feels.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE
dialogues.text: (Without looking at Shutu) You want to hold it haan?

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: You show me how to hold it Uncle. Aap nahi dikhayenge toh...

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE
dialogues.text: Okay. Just to hold it. Wait. Uncle carefully puts the safety catch back on. With one a still holding the rifle, Uncle lets Shutu hold it; Shutu closes in. He tightens his grip on the rifle and in one s movement scampers off to a distance.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wapas karo Shutu. Kya kar rahe ho? Shutu backs away unsteadily.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nandu! Nandu and the others turn around to see Shutu pointing th rifle at Uncle. Vikram hurriedly takes a few steps toward Shutu.  104.

dialogues.speaker: NANDU
dialogues.text: Shutu! Shutu reacts to Nandu’s voice. His hands shake as he move the rifle ever so slightly. Vikram is now in the direct l of fire. NANDU (0.C.) (CONT’D) Bonnie take Tani inside! Uncle turns back from Vikram to see that the rifle is no longer aimed at him. He takes a step forward.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE
dialogues.text: Shutu, don’t do this. Shutu continues backing away until he hits a tree. He pan as Vikram is fast approaching him. Shutu feeling cornered, removes the safety lock with trembling fingers. Uncle freezes. Shutu puts his finger o the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Beta kya kar rahe ho? Bonnie hugs Tani to shield her from the scene.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: (desperately) Shutu please! With one arm outstretched to reason with Shutu, Vikram wa slowly and deliberately towards him. With his other hand Vikram reaches for his own gun.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: (In a steady voice) Shutu put that gun down now. There’s a moment of fevered panic in Shutu’s eyes as Vikr comes even closer to him. Shutu grips the rifle tighter, aiming straight at Vikram. Vikram, unafraid, continues to approach Shutu.

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You don’t need to do this, Shutu. Shutu’s eyes well up. He lowers his rifle. The others sta to come closer.

dialogues.speaker: SHUTU
dialogues.text: (Under his breath) Sorry.  168 105. There is a certain calm in his eyes now. Suddenly, with lightening speed, he turns the barrel to the base of his and fires. Vikram freezes in shock as a few drops of blood splatter his face. We hear Bonnie’s anguished cry. Uncle rushes towards the house.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE
dialogues.text: Shutu goli kha gaya! Shutu goli kha gaya! High Speed: In the foreground, a eucalyptus tree stands w a fresh stain of blood as the smoke curls into the frame. Bonnie collapses with Tani on the grass. Mimi covers her with both hands in shock. Nandu holds his head in his han and falls to his knees. Brian’s face is white as a sheet. In a low angle from Shutu’s POV, Vikram rushes to the tre Brian helps Nandu as he stumbles and falls. Mimi stands rooted to the spot in horror. We dissolve to the same shot at dusk as Bonnie, Nandu, Br Mimi and Vikram slowly disappear from the frame. A police siren is heard in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. MCCLUSKIEGUNJ HOUSE. INDETERMINATE HOUR 168
dialogues.text: It is the same frame as in the previous shot, only a litt darker. A steady cam rises and languidly weaves it’s way the house, starting from the verandah steps. The house is dimly lit. We catch a glimpse of Uncle, Vikram and Nandu the dinning table with a police officer who is taking not The rifle lies on the table. We pan from them to the mantle piece where the missing ri is marked by a dusty outline. As we move to the next room the lights die down. It is night, in their bedroom, Uncle sits still while Aunty lies awake next to him. As we move further through the door into Mimi’s room whic empty, the bed is unmade and her article remains incomple Moving further into the kitchen through the corridor, lig changes to day. We see Manjari working absentmindedly. As move away, early morning light fills the corridor. Aunty stares at her cup of tea, sitting still. Day turns to night as we weave through the living room in darkness and see Nandu sitting at a distance in the veran smoking a cigarette. At a crack of dawn, we move into Bonnie’s room and see he sitting in front of an open suitcase, looking blankly ahe  169 170 170.

We leave her as the camera travels through the bathroom a daylight floods in, a closed door opens into Shutu’s room His backpack has been emptied of his clothes, books and toiletries as they lie strewn on the bed. We stop at his where his journal lies open. A few pages flutter in the breeze and peeking out from one of the pages is the envel addressed to his mother. Mimi is standing at a window of Shutu’s room, smoking a cigarette, looking out. As the li bleaches to white at the window. Outside the window, we see Tani on the tyre swing. As she moves eerily in slow motion, we pan to see scratched into tree trunk is Shutu’s name in childish writing. Beneath i in a more adult hand are his dates: [1956 - 1979]. The camera moves through the trees till it comes to the r adjoining the orchard. Nandu’s ambassador whizzes past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are back to the present, the opening sequence. In a se of long shots we see the same ambassador on a lonely stre of highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the window of the driver’s seat we see Nandu in t foreground in profile, driving and smoking. In the backgr we see a grim Brian sitting in the front passenger seat w a hanky to his mouth. Through the front windscreen we see Shutu wearing the sam clothes as the last time we saw him. He sits in the middl the backseat, looking worried, scared and sad. We move to extreme close up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They leave behind McCluskeigunj as we see dense forest closing in behind the speeding car. CUT TO BLACK. THE END.
